458 /* This function overwrites a few normal Redis config default with Sentinel
459  * specific defaults. */
460 void initSentinelConfig(void) {
461  server.port = REDIS_SENTINEL_PORT;
462 }
463 
464 /* Perform the Sentinel mode initialization. */
465 void initSentinel(void) {
466  unsigned int j;
467 
468  /* Remove usual Redis commands from the command table, then just add
469  * the SENTINEL command. */
470  dictEmpty(server.commands,NULL);
471  for (j = 0; j < sizeof(sentinelcmds)/sizeof(sentinelcmds[0]); j++) {
472  int retval;
473  struct redisCommand *cmd = sentinelcmds+j;
474 
475  retval = dictAdd(server.commands, sdsnew(cmd->name), cmd);
476  serverAssert(retval == DICT_OK);
477  }
478 
479  /* Initialize various data structures. */
480  sentinel.current_epoch = 0;
481  sentinel.masters = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
482  sentinel.tilt = 0;
483  sentinel.tilt_start_time = 0;
484  sentinel.previous_time = mstime();
485  sentinel.running_scripts = 0;
486  sentinel.scripts_queue = listCreate();
487  sentinel.announce_ip = NULL;
488  sentinel.announce_port = 0;
489  sentinel.simfailure_flags = SENTINEL_SIMFAILURE_NONE;
490  sentinel.deny_scripts_reconfig = SENTINEL_DEFAULT_DENY_SCRIPTS_RECONFIG;
491  memset(sentinel.myid,0,sizeof(sentinel.myid));
492 }
493 
494 /* This function gets called when the server is in Sentinel mode, started,
495  * loaded the configuration, and is ready for normal operations. */
496 void sentinelIsRunning(void) {
497  int j;
498 
499  if (server.configfile == NULL) {
500  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
501  "Sentinel started without a config file. Exiting...");
502  exit(1);
503  } else if (access(server.configfile,W_OK) == -1) {
504  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
505  "Sentinel config file %s is not writable: %s. Exiting...",
506  server.configfile,strerror(errno));
507  exit(1);
508  }
509 
510  /* If this Sentinel has yet no ID set in the configuration file, we
511  * pick a random one and persist the config on disk. From now on this
512  * will be this Sentinel ID across restarts. */
513  for (j = 0; j < CONFIG_RUN_ID_SIZE; j++)
514  if (sentinel.myid[j] != 0) break;
515 
516  if (j == CONFIG_RUN_ID_SIZE) {
517  /* Pick ID and persist the config. */
518  getRandomHexChars(sentinel.myid,CONFIG_RUN_ID_SIZE);
519  sentinelFlushConfig();
520  }
521 
522  /* Log its ID to make debugging of issues simpler. */
523  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Sentinel ID is %s", sentinel.myid);
524 
525  /* We want to generate a +monitor event for every configured master
526  * at startup. */
527  sentinelGenerateInitialMonitorEvents();
528 }
529 
530 /* ============================== sentinelAddr ============================== */
531 
532 /* Create a sentinelAddr object and return it on success.
533  * On error NULL is returned and errno is set to:
534  * ENOENT: Can't resolve the hostname.
535  * EINVAL: Invalid port number.
536  */
537 sentinelAddr *createSentinelAddr(char *hostname, int port) {
538  char ip[NET_IP_STR_LEN];
539  sentinelAddr *sa;
540 
541  if (port < 0 || port > 65535) {
542  errno = EINVAL;
543  return NULL;
544  }
545  if (anetResolve(NULL,hostname,ip,sizeof(ip)) == ANET_ERR) {
546  errno = ENOENT;
547  return NULL;
548  }
549  sa = zmalloc(sizeof(*sa));
550  sa->ip = sdsnew(ip);
551  sa->port = port;
552  return sa;
553 }
554 
555 /* Return a duplicate of the source address. */
556 sentinelAddr *dupSentinelAddr(sentinelAddr *src) {
557  sentinelAddr *sa;
558 
559  sa = zmalloc(sizeof(*sa));
560  sa->ip = sdsnew(src->ip);
561  sa->port = src->port;
562  return sa;
563 }
564 
565 /* Free a Sentinel address. Can't fail. */
566 void releaseSentinelAddr(sentinelAddr *sa) {
567  sdsfree(sa->ip);
568  zfree(sa);
569 }
570 
571 /* Return non-zero if two addresses are equal. */
572 int sentinelAddrIsEqual(sentinelAddr *a, sentinelAddr *b) {
573  return a->port == b->port && !strcasecmp(a->ip,b->ip);
574 }
575 
576 /* =========================== Events notification ========================== */
577 
578 /* Send an event to log, pub/sub, user notification script.
579  *
580  * 'level' is the log level for logging. Only LL_WARNING events will trigger
581  * the execution of the user notification script.
582  *
583  * 'type' is the message type, also used as a pub/sub channel name.
584  *
585  * 'ri', is the redis instance target of this event if applicable, and is
586  * used to obtain the path of the notification script to execute.
587  *
588  * The remaining arguments are printf-alike.
589  * If the format specifier starts with the two characters "%@" then ri is
590  * not NULL, and the message is prefixed with an instance identifier in the
591  * following format:
592  *
593  * <instance type> <instance name> <ip> <port>
594  *
595  * If the instance type is not master, than the additional string is
596  * added to specify the originating master:
597  *
598  * @ <master name> <master ip> <master port>
599  *
600  * Any other specifier after "%@" is processed by printf itself.
601  */
602 void sentinelEvent(int level, char *type, sentinelRedisInstance *ri,
603  const char *fmt, ...) {
604  va_list ap;
605  char msg[LOG_MAX_LEN];
606  robj *channel, *payload;
607 
608  /* Handle %@ */
609  if (fmt[0] == '%' && fmt[1] == '@') {
610  sentinelRedisInstance *master = (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) ?
611  NULL : ri->master;
612 
613  if (master) {
614  snprintf(msg, sizeof(msg), "%s %s %s %d @ %s %s %d",
615  sentinelRedisInstanceTypeStr(ri),
616  ri->name, ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port,
617  master->name, master->addr->ip, master->addr->port);
618  } else {
619  snprintf(msg, sizeof(msg), "%s %s %s %d",
620  sentinelRedisInstanceTypeStr(ri),
621  ri->name, ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port);
622  }
623  fmt += 2;
624  } else {
625  msg[0] = '\0';
626  }
627 
628  /* Use vsprintf for the rest of the formatting if any. */
629  if (fmt[0] != '\0') {
630  va_start(ap, fmt);
631  vsnprintf(msg+strlen(msg), sizeof(msg)-strlen(msg), fmt, ap);
632  va_end(ap);
633  }
634 
635  /* Log the message if the log level allows it to be logged. */
636  if (level >= server.verbosity)
637  serverLog(level,"%s %s",type,msg);
638 
639  /* Publish the message via Pub/Sub if it's not a debugging one. */
640  if (level != LL_DEBUG) {
641  channel = createStringObject(type,strlen(type));
642  payload = createStringObject(msg,strlen(msg));
643  pubsubPublishMessage(channel,payload);
644  decrRefCount(channel);
645  decrRefCount(payload);
646  }
647 
648  /* Call the notification script if applicable. */
649  if (level == LL_WARNING && ri != NULL) {
650  sentinelRedisInstance *master = (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) ?
651  ri : ri->master;
652  if (master && master->notification_script) {
653  sentinelScheduleScriptExecution(master->notification_script,
654  type,msg,NULL);
655  }
656  }
657 }
658 
659 /* This function is called only at startup and is used to generate a
660  * +monitor event for every configured master. The same events are also
661  * generated when a master to monitor is added at runtime via the
662  * SENTINEL MONITOR command. */
663 void sentinelGenerateInitialMonitorEvents(void) {
664  dictIterator *di;
665  dictEntry *de;
666 
667  di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
668  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
669  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
670  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+monitor",ri,"%@ quorum %d",ri->quorum);
671  }
672  dictReleaseIterator(di);
673 }
674 
675 /* ============================ script execution ============================ */
676 
677 /* Release a script job structure and all the associated data. */
678 void sentinelReleaseScriptJob(sentinelScriptJob *sj) {
679  int j = 0;
680 
681  while(sj->argv[j]) sdsfree(sj->argv[j++]);
682  zfree(sj->argv);
683  zfree(sj);
684 }
685 
686 #define SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_ARGS 16
687 void sentinelScheduleScriptExecution(char *path, ...) {
688  va_list ap;
689  char *argv[SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_ARGS+1];
690  int argc = 1;
691  sentinelScriptJob *sj;
692 
693  va_start(ap, path);
694  while(argc < SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_ARGS) {
695  argv[argc] = va_arg(ap,char*);
696  if (!argv[argc]) break;
697  argv[argc] = sdsnew(argv[argc]); /* Copy the string. */
698  argc++;
699  }
700  va_end(ap);
701  argv[0] = sdsnew(path);
702 
703  sj = zmalloc(sizeof(*sj));
704  sj->flags = SENTINEL_SCRIPT_NONE;
705  sj->retry_num = 0;
706  sj->argv = zmalloc(sizeof(char*)*(argc+1));
707  sj->start_time = 0;
708  sj->pid = 0;
709  memcpy(sj->argv,argv,sizeof(char*)*(argc+1));
710 
711  listAddNodeTail(sentinel.scripts_queue,sj);
712 
713  /* Remove the oldest non running script if we already hit the limit. */
714  if (listLength(sentinel.scripts_queue) > SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_QUEUE) {
715  listNode *ln;
716  listIter li;
717 
718  listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
719  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
720  sj = ln->value;
721 
722  if (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) continue;
723  /* The first node is the oldest as we add on tail. */
724  listDelNode(sentinel.scripts_queue,ln);
725  sentinelReleaseScriptJob(sj);
726  break;
727  }
728  serverAssert(listLength(sentinel.scripts_queue) <=
729  SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_QUEUE);
730  }
731 }
732 
733 /* Lookup a script in the scripts queue via pid, and returns the list node
734  * (so that we can easily remove it from the queue if needed). */
735 listNode *sentinelGetScriptListNodeByPid(pid_t pid) {
736  listNode *ln;
737  listIter li;
738 
739  listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
740  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
741  sentinelScriptJob *sj = ln->value;
742 
743  if ((sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) && sj->pid == pid)
744  return ln;
745  }
746  return NULL;
747 }
748 
749 /* Run pending scripts if we are not already at max number of running
750  * scripts. */
751 void sentinelRunPendingScripts(void) {
752  listNode *ln;
753  listIter li;
754  mstime_t now = mstime();
755 
756  /* Find jobs that are not running and run them, from the top to the
757  * tail of the queue, so we run older jobs first. */
758  listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
759  while (sentinel.running_scripts < SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RUNNING &&
760  (ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL)
761  {
762  sentinelScriptJob *sj = ln->value;
763  pid_t pid;
764 
765  /* Skip if already running. */
766  if (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) continue;
767 
768  /* Skip if it's a retry, but not enough time has elapsed. */
769  if (sj->start_time && sj->start_time > now) continue;
770 
771  sj->flags |= SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING;
772  sj->start_time = mstime();
773  sj->retry_num++;
774  pid = fork();
775 
776  if (pid == -1) {
777  /* Parent (fork error).
778  * We report fork errors as signal 99, in order to unify the
779  * reporting with other kind of errors. */
780  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-script-error",NULL,
781  "%s %d %d", sj->argv[0], 99, 0);
782  sj->flags &= ~SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING;
783  sj->pid = 0;
784  } else if (pid == 0) {
785  /* Child */
786  execve(sj->argv[0],sj->argv,environ);
787  /* If we are here an error occurred. */
788  _exit(2); /* Don't retry execution. */
789  } else {
790  sentinel.running_scripts++;
791  sj->pid = pid;
792  sentinelEvent(LL_DEBUG,"+script-child",NULL,"%ld",(long)pid);
793  }
794  }
795 }
796 
797 /* How much to delay the execution of a script that we need to retry after
798  * an error?
799  *
800  * We double the retry delay for every further retry we do. So for instance
801  * if RETRY_DELAY is set to 30 seconds and the max number of retries is 10
802  * starting from the second attempt to execute the script the delays are:
803  * 30 sec, 60 sec, 2 min, 4 min, 8 min, 16 min, 32 min, 64 min, 128 min. */
804 mstime_t sentinelScriptRetryDelay(int retry_num) {
805  mstime_t delay = SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RETRY_DELAY;
806 
807  while (retry_num-- > 1) delay *= 2;
808  return delay;
809 }
810 
811 /* Check for scripts that terminated, and remove them from the queue if the
812  * script terminated successfully. If instead the script was terminated by
813  * a signal, or returned exit code "1", it is scheduled to run again if
814  * the max number of retries did not already elapsed. */
815 void sentinelCollectTerminatedScripts(void) {
816  int statloc;
817  pid_t pid;
818 
819  while ((pid = wait3(&statloc,WNOHANG,NULL)) > 0) {
820  int exitcode = WEXITSTATUS(statloc);
821  int bysignal = 0;
822  listNode *ln;
823  sentinelScriptJob *sj;
824 
825  if (WIFSIGNALED(statloc)) bysignal = WTERMSIG(statloc);
826  sentinelEvent(LL_DEBUG,"-script-child",NULL,"%ld %d %d",
827  (long)pid, exitcode, bysignal);
828 
829  ln = sentinelGetScriptListNodeByPid(pid);
830  if (ln == NULL) {
831  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"wait3() returned a pid (%ld) we can't find in our scripts execution queue!", (long)pid);
832  continue;
833  }
834  sj = ln->value;
835 
836  /* If the script was terminated by a signal or returns an
837  * exit code of "1" (that means: please retry), we reschedule it
838  * if the max number of retries is not already reached. */
839  if ((bysignal || exitcode == 1) &&
840  sj->retry_num != SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RETRY)
841  {
842  sj->flags &= ~SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING;
843  sj->pid = 0;
844  sj->start_time = mstime() +
845  sentinelScriptRetryDelay(sj->retry_num);
846  } else {
847  /* Otherwise let's remove the script, but log the event if the
848  * execution did not terminated in the best of the ways. */
849  if (bysignal || exitcode != 0) {
850  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-script-error",NULL,
851  "%s %d %d", sj->argv[0], bysignal, exitcode);
852  }
853  listDelNode(sentinel.scripts_queue,ln);
854  sentinelReleaseScriptJob(sj);
855  sentinel.running_scripts--;
856  }
857  }
858 }
859 
860 /* Kill scripts in timeout, they'll be collected by the
861  * sentinelCollectTerminatedScripts() function. */
862 void sentinelKillTimedoutScripts(void) {
863  listNode *ln;
864  listIter li;
865  mstime_t now = mstime();
866 
867  listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
868  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
869  sentinelScriptJob *sj = ln->value;
870 
871  if (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING &&
872  (now - sj->start_time) > SENTINEL_SCRIPT_MAX_RUNTIME)
873  {
874  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-script-timeout",NULL,"%s %ld",
875  sj->argv[0], (long)sj->pid);
876  kill(sj->pid,SIGKILL);
877  }
878  }
879 }
880 
881 /* Implements SENTINEL PENDING-SCRIPTS command. */
882 void sentinelPendingScriptsCommand(client *c) {
883  listNode *ln;
884  listIter li;
885 
886  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,listLength(sentinel.scripts_queue));
887  listRewind(sentinel.scripts_queue,&li);
888  while ((ln = listNext(&li)) != NULL) {
889  sentinelScriptJob *sj = ln->value;
890  int j = 0;
891 
892  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,10);
893 
894  addReplyBulkCString(c,"argv");
895  while (sj->argv[j]) j++;
896  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,j);
897  j = 0;
898  while (sj->argv[j]) addReplyBulkCString(c,sj->argv[j++]);
899 
900  addReplyBulkCString(c,"flags");
901  addReplyBulkCString(c,
902  (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) ? "running" : "scheduled");
903 
904  addReplyBulkCString(c,"pid");
905  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,sj->pid);
906 
907  if (sj->flags & SENTINEL_SCRIPT_RUNNING) {
908  addReplyBulkCString(c,"run-time");
909  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - sj->start_time);
910  } else {
911  mstime_t delay = sj->start_time ? (sj->start_time-mstime()) : 0;
912  if (delay < 0) delay = 0;
913  addReplyBulkCString(c,"run-delay");
914  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,delay);
915  }
916 
917  addReplyBulkCString(c,"retry-num");
918  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,sj->retry_num);
919  }
920 }
921 
922 /* This function calls, if any, the client reconfiguration script with the
923  * following parameters:
924  *
925  * <master-name> <role> <state> <from-ip> <from-port> <to-ip> <to-port>
926  *
927  * It is called every time a failover is performed.
928  *
929  * <state> is currently always "failover".
930  * <role> is either "leader" or "observer".
931  *
932  * from/to fields are respectively master -> promoted slave addresses for
933  * "start" and "end". */
934 void sentinelCallClientReconfScript(sentinelRedisInstance *master, int role, char *state, sentinelAddr *from, sentinelAddr *to) {
935  char fromport[32], toport[32];
936 
937  if (master->client_reconfig_script == NULL) return;
938  ll2string(fromport,sizeof(fromport),from->port);
939  ll2string(toport,sizeof(toport),to->port);
940  sentinelScheduleScriptExecution(master->client_reconfig_script,
941  master->name,
942  (role == SENTINEL_LEADER) ? "leader" : "observer",
943  state, from->ip, fromport, to->ip, toport, NULL);
944 }
945 
946 /* =============================== instanceLink ============================= */
947 
948 /* Create a not yet connected link object. */
949 instanceLink *createInstanceLink(void) {
950  instanceLink *link = zmalloc(sizeof(*link));
951 
952  link->refcount = 1;
953  link->disconnected = 1;
954  link->pending_commands = 0;
955  link->cc = NULL;
956  link->pc = NULL;
957  link->cc_conn_time = 0;
958  link->pc_conn_time = 0;
959  link->last_reconn_time = 0;
960  link->pc_last_activity = 0;
961  /* We set the act_ping_time to "now" even if we actually don't have yet
962  * a connection with the node, nor we sent a ping.
963  * This is useful to detect a timeout in case we'll not be able to connect
964  * with the node at all. */
965  link->act_ping_time = mstime();
966  link->last_ping_time = 0;
967  link->last_avail_time = mstime();
968  link->last_pong_time = mstime();
969  return link;
970 }
971 
972 /* Disconnect an hiredis connection in the context of an instance link. */
973 void instanceLinkCloseConnection(instanceLink *link, redisAsyncContext *c) {
974  if (c == NULL) return;
975 
976  if (link->cc == c) {
977  link->cc = NULL;
978  link->pending_commands = 0;
979  }
980  if (link->pc == c) link->pc = NULL;
981  c->data = NULL;
982  link->disconnected = 1;
983  redisAsyncFree(c);
984 }
985 
986 /* Decrement the refcount of a link object, if it drops to zero, actually
987  * free it and return NULL. Otherwise don't do anything and return the pointer
988  * to the object.
989  *
990  * If we are not going to free the link and ri is not NULL, we rebind all the
991  * pending requests in link->cc (hiredis connection for commands) to a
992  * callback that will just ignore them. This is useful to avoid processing
993  * replies for an instance that no longer exists. */
994 instanceLink *releaseInstanceLink(instanceLink *link, sentinelRedisInstance *ri)
995 {
996  serverAssert(link->refcount > 0);
997  link->refcount--;
998  if (link->refcount != 0) {
999  if (ri && ri->link->cc) {
1000  /* This instance may have pending callbacks in the hiredis async
1001  * context, having as 'privdata' the instance that we are going to
1002  * free. Let's rewrite the callback list, directly exploiting
1003  * hiredis internal data structures, in order to bind them with
1004  * a callback that will ignore the reply at all. */
1005  redisCallback *cb;
1006  redisCallbackList *callbacks = &link->cc->replies;
1007 
1008  cb = callbacks->head;
1009  while(cb) {
1010  if (cb->privdata == ri) {
1011  cb->fn = sentinelDiscardReplyCallback;
1012  cb->privdata = NULL; /* Not strictly needed. */
1013  }
1014  cb = cb->next;
1015  }
1016  }
1017  return link; /* Other active users. */
1018  }
1019 
1020  instanceLinkCloseConnection(link,link->cc);
1021  instanceLinkCloseConnection(link,link->pc);
1022  zfree(link);
1023  return NULL;
1024 }
1025 
1026 /* This function will attempt to share the instance link we already have
1027  * for the same Sentinel in the context of a different master, with the
1028  * instance we are passing as argument.
1029  *
1030  * This way multiple Sentinel objects that refer all to the same physical
1031  * Sentinel instance but in the context of different masters will use
1032  * a single connection, will send a single PING per second for failure
1033  * detection and so forth.
1034  *
1035  * Return C_OK if a matching Sentinel was found in the context of a
1036  * different master and sharing was performed. Otherwise C_ERR
1037  * is returned. */
1038 int sentinelTryConnectionSharing(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1039  serverAssert(ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL);
1040  dictIterator *di;
1041  dictEntry *de;
1042 
1043  if (ri->runid == NULL) return C_ERR; /* No way to identify it. */
1044  if (ri->link->refcount > 1) return C_ERR; /* Already shared. */
1045 
1046  di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
1047  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1048  sentinelRedisInstance *master = dictGetVal(de), *match;
1049  /* We want to share with the same physical Sentinel referenced
1050  * in other masters, so skip our master. */
1051  if (master == ri->master) continue;
1052  match = getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(master->sentinels,
1053  NULL,0,ri->runid);
1054  if (match == NULL) continue; /* No match. */
1055  if (match == ri) continue; /* Should never happen but... safer. */
1056 
1057  /* We identified a matching Sentinel, great! Let's free our link
1058  * and use the one of the matching Sentinel. */
1059  releaseInstanceLink(ri->link,NULL);
1060  ri->link = match->link;
1061  match->link->refcount++;
1062  return C_OK;
1063  }
1064  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1065  return C_ERR;
1066 }
1067 
1068 /* When we detect a Sentinel to switch address (reporting a different IP/port
1069  * pair in Hello messages), let's update all the matching Sentinels in the
1070  * context of other masters as well and disconnect the links, so that everybody
1071  * will be updated.
1072  *
1073  * Return the number of updated Sentinel addresses. */
1074 int sentinelUpdateSentinelAddressInAllMasters(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1075  serverAssert(ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL);
1076  dictIterator *di;
1077  dictEntry *de;
1078  int reconfigured = 0;
1079 
1080  di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
1081  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1082  sentinelRedisInstance *master = dictGetVal(de), *match;
1083  match = getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(master->sentinels,
1084  NULL,0,ri->runid);
1085  /* If there is no match, this master does not know about this
1086  * Sentinel, try with the next one. */
1087  if (match == NULL) continue;
1088 
1089  /* Disconnect the old links if connected. */
1090  if (match->link->cc != NULL)
1091  instanceLinkCloseConnection(match->link,match->link->cc);
1092  if (match->link->pc != NULL)
1093  instanceLinkCloseConnection(match->link,match->link->pc);
1094 
1095  if (match == ri) continue; /* Address already updated for it. */
1096 
1097  /* Update the address of the matching Sentinel by copying the address
1098  * of the Sentinel object that received the address update. */
1099  releaseSentinelAddr(match->addr);
1100  match->addr = dupSentinelAddr(ri->addr);
1101  reconfigured++;
1102  }
1103  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1104  if (reconfigured)
1105  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+sentinel-address-update", ri,
1106  "%@ %d additional matching instances", reconfigured);
1107  return reconfigured;
1108 }
1109 
1110 /* This function is called when an hiredis connection reported an error.
1111  * We set it to NULL and mark the link as disconnected so that it will be
1112  * reconnected again.
1113  *
1114  * Note: we don't free the hiredis context as hiredis will do it for us
1115  * for async connections. */
1116 void instanceLinkConnectionError(const redisAsyncContext *c) {
1117  instanceLink *link = c->data;
1118  int pubsub;
1119 
1120  if (!link) return;
1121 
1122  pubsub = (link->pc == c);
1123  if (pubsub)
1124  link->pc = NULL;
1125  else
1126  link->cc = NULL;
1127  link->disconnected = 1;
1128 }
1129 
1130 /* Hiredis connection established / disconnected callbacks. We need them
1131  * just to cleanup our link state. */
1132 void sentinelLinkEstablishedCallback(const redisAsyncContext *c, int status) {
1133  if (status != C_OK) instanceLinkConnectionError(c);
1134 }
1135 
1136 void sentinelDisconnectCallback(const redisAsyncContext *c, int status) {
1137  UNUSED(status);
1138  instanceLinkConnectionError(c);
1139 }
1140 
1141 /* ========================== sentinelRedisInstance ========================= */
1142 
1143 /* Create a redis instance, the following fields must be populated by the
1144  * caller if needed:
1145  * runid: set to NULL but will be populated once INFO output is received.
1146  * info_refresh: is set to 0 to mean that we never received INFO so far.
1147  *
1148  * If SRI_MASTER is set into initial flags the instance is added to
1149  * sentinel.masters table.
1150  *
1151  * if SRI_SLAVE or SRI_SENTINEL is set then 'master' must be not NULL and the
1152  * instance is added into master->slaves or master->sentinels table.
1153  *
1154  * If the instance is a slave or sentinel, the name parameter is ignored and
1155  * is created automatically as hostname:port.
1156  *
1157  * The function fails if hostname can't be resolved or port is out of range.
1158  * When this happens NULL is returned and errno is set accordingly to the
1159  * createSentinelAddr() function.
1160  *
1161  * The function may also fail and return NULL with errno set to EBUSY if
1162  * a master with the same name, a slave with the same address, or a sentinel
1163  * with the same ID already exists. */
1164 
1165 sentinelRedisInstance *createSentinelRedisInstance(char *name, int flags, char *hostname, int port, int quorum, sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
1166  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
1167  sentinelAddr *addr;
1168  dict *table = NULL;
1169  char slavename[NET_PEER_ID_LEN], *sdsname;
1170 
1171  serverAssert(flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE|SRI_SENTINEL));
1172  serverAssert((flags & SRI_MASTER) || master != NULL);
1173 
1174  /* Check address validity. */
1175  addr = createSentinelAddr(hostname,port);
1176  if (addr == NULL) return NULL;
1177 
1178  /* For slaves use ip:port as name. */
1179  if (flags & SRI_SLAVE) {
1180  anetFormatAddr(slavename, sizeof(slavename), hostname, port);
1181  name = slavename;
1182  }
1183 
1184  /* Make sure the entry is not duplicated. This may happen when the same
1185  * name for a master is used multiple times inside the configuration or
1186  * if we try to add multiple times a slave or sentinel with same ip/port
1187  * to a master. */
1188  if (flags & SRI_MASTER) table = sentinel.masters;
1189  else if (flags & SRI_SLAVE) table = master->slaves;
1190  else if (flags & SRI_SENTINEL) table = master->sentinels;
1191  sdsname = sdsnew(name);
1192  if (dictFind(table,sdsname)) {
1193  releaseSentinelAddr(addr);
1194  sdsfree(sdsname);
1195  errno = EBUSY;
1196  return NULL;
1197  }
1198 
1199  /* Create the instance object. */
1200  ri = zmalloc(sizeof(*ri));
1201  /* Note that all the instances are started in the disconnected state,
1202  * the event loop will take care of connecting them. */
1203  ri->flags = flags;
1204  ri->name = sdsname;
1205  ri->runid = NULL;
1206  ri->config_epoch = 0;
1207  ri->addr = addr;
1208  ri->link = createInstanceLink();
1209  ri->last_pub_time = mstime();
1210  ri->last_hello_time = mstime();
1211  ri->last_master_down_reply_time = mstime();
1212  ri->s_down_since_time = 0;
1213  ri->o_down_since_time = 0;
1214  ri->down_after_period = master ? master->down_after_period :
1215  SENTINEL_DEFAULT_DOWN_AFTER;
1216  ri->master_link_down_time = 0;
1217  ri->auth_pass = NULL;
1218  ri->slave_priority = SENTINEL_DEFAULT_SLAVE_PRIORITY;
1219  ri->slave_reconf_sent_time = 0;
1220  ri->slave_master_host = NULL;
1221  ri->slave_master_port = 0;
1222  ri->slave_master_link_status = SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_DOWN;
1223  ri->slave_repl_offset = 0;
1224  ri->sentinels = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
1225  ri->quorum = quorum;
1226  ri->parallel_syncs = SENTINEL_DEFAULT_PARALLEL_SYNCS;
1227  ri->master = master;
1228  ri->slaves = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
1229  ri->info_refresh = 0;
1230  ri->renamed_commands = dictCreate(&renamedCommandsDictType,NULL);
1231 
1232  /* Failover state. */
1233  ri->leader = NULL;
1234  ri->leader_epoch = 0;
1235  ri->failover_epoch = 0;
1236  ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE;
1237  ri->failover_state_change_time = 0;
1238  ri->failover_start_time = 0;
1239  ri->failover_timeout = SENTINEL_DEFAULT_FAILOVER_TIMEOUT;
1240  ri->failover_delay_logged = 0;
1241  ri->promoted_slave = NULL;
1242  ri->notification_script = NULL;
1243  ri->client_reconfig_script = NULL;
1244  ri->info = NULL;
1245 
1246  /* Role */
1247  ri->role_reported = ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE);
1248  ri->role_reported_time = mstime();
1249  ri->slave_conf_change_time = mstime();
1250 
1251  /* Add into the right table. */
1252  dictAdd(table, ri->name, ri);
1253  return ri;
1254 }
1255 
1256 /* Release this instance and all its slaves, sentinels, hiredis connections.
1257  * This function does not take care of unlinking the instance from the main
1258  * masters table (if it is a master) or from its master sentinels/slaves table
1259  * if it is a slave or sentinel. */
1260 void releaseSentinelRedisInstance(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1261  /* Release all its slaves or sentinels if any. */
1262  dictRelease(ri->sentinels);
1263  dictRelease(ri->slaves);
1264 
1265  /* Disconnect the instance. */
1266  releaseInstanceLink(ri->link,ri);
1267 
1268  /* Free other resources. */
1269  sdsfree(ri->name);
1270  sdsfree(ri->runid);
1271  sdsfree(ri->notification_script);
1272  sdsfree(ri->client_reconfig_script);
1273  sdsfree(ri->slave_master_host);
1274  sdsfree(ri->leader);
1275  sdsfree(ri->auth_pass);
1276  sdsfree(ri->info);
1277  releaseSentinelAddr(ri->addr);
1278  dictRelease(ri->renamed_commands);
1279 
1280  /* Clear state into the master if needed. */
1281  if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) && (ri->flags & SRI_PROMOTED) && ri->master)
1282  ri->master->promoted_slave = NULL;
1283 
1284  zfree(ri);
1285 }
1286 
1287 /* Lookup a slave in a master Redis instance, by ip and port. */
1288 sentinelRedisInstance *sentinelRedisInstanceLookupSlave(
1289  sentinelRedisInstance *ri, char *ip, int port)
1290 {
1291  sds key;
1292  sentinelRedisInstance *slave;
1293  char buf[NET_PEER_ID_LEN];
1294 
1295  serverAssert(ri->flags & SRI_MASTER);
1296  anetFormatAddr(buf,sizeof(buf),ip,port);
1297  key = sdsnew(buf);
1298  slave = dictFetchValue(ri->slaves,key);
1299  sdsfree(key);
1300  return slave;
1301 }
1302 
1303 /* Return the name of the type of the instance as a string. */
1304 const char *sentinelRedisInstanceTypeStr(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1305  if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) return "master";
1306  else if (ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) return "slave";
1307  else if (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) return "sentinel";
1308  else return "unknown";
1309 }
1310 
1311 /* This function remove the Sentinel with the specified ID from the
1312  * specified master.
1313  *
1314  * If "runid" is NULL the function returns ASAP.
1315  *
1316  * This function is useful because on Sentinels address switch, we want to
1317  * remove our old entry and add a new one for the same ID but with the new
1318  * address.
1319  *
1320  * The function returns 1 if the matching Sentinel was removed, otherwise
1321  * 0 if there was no Sentinel with this ID. */
1322 int removeMatchingSentinelFromMaster(sentinelRedisInstance *master, char *runid) {
1323  dictIterator *di;
1324  dictEntry *de;
1325  int removed = 0;
1326 
1327  if (runid == NULL) return 0;
1328 
1329  di = dictGetSafeIterator(master->sentinels);
1330  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1331  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1332 
1333  if (ri->runid && strcmp(ri->runid,runid) == 0) {
1334  dictDelete(master->sentinels,ri->name);
1335  removed++;
1336  }
1337  }
1338  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1339  return removed;
1340 }
1341 
1342 /* Search an instance with the same runid, ip and port into a dictionary
1343  * of instances. Return NULL if not found, otherwise return the instance
1344  * pointer.
1345  *
1346  * runid or ip can be NULL. In such a case the search is performed only
1347  * by the non-NULL field. */
1348 sentinelRedisInstance *getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(dict *instances, char *ip, int port, char *runid) {
1349  dictIterator *di;
1350  dictEntry *de;
1351  sentinelRedisInstance *instance = NULL;
1352 
1353  serverAssert(ip || runid); /* User must pass at least one search param. */
1354  di = dictGetIterator(instances);
1355  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1356  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1357 
1358  if (runid && !ri->runid) continue;
1359  if ((runid == NULL || strcmp(ri->runid, runid) == 0) &&
1360  (ip == NULL || (strcmp(ri->addr->ip, ip) == 0 &&
1361  ri->addr->port == port)))
1362  {
1363  instance = ri;
1364  break;
1365  }
1366  }
1367  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1368  return instance;
1369 }
1370 
1371 /* Master lookup by name */
1372 sentinelRedisInstance *sentinelGetMasterByName(char *name) {
1373  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
1374  sds sdsname = sdsnew(name);
1375 
1376  ri = dictFetchValue(sentinel.masters,sdsname);
1377  sdsfree(sdsname);
1378  return ri;
1379 }
1380 
1381 /* Add the specified flags to all the instances in the specified dictionary. */
1382 void sentinelAddFlagsToDictOfRedisInstances(dict *instances, int flags) {
1383  dictIterator *di;
1384  dictEntry *de;
1385 
1386  di = dictGetIterator(instances);
1387  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1388  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1389  ri->flags |= flags;
1390  }
1391  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1392 }
1393 
1394 /* Remove the specified flags to all the instances in the specified
1395  * dictionary. */
1396 void sentinelDelFlagsToDictOfRedisInstances(dict *instances, int flags) {
1397  dictIterator *di;
1398  dictEntry *de;
1399 
1400  di = dictGetIterator(instances);
1401  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1402  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1403  ri->flags &= ~flags;
1404  }
1405  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1406 }
1407 
1408 /* Reset the state of a monitored master:
1409  * 1) Remove all slaves.
1410  * 2) Remove all sentinels.
1411  * 3) Remove most of the flags resulting from runtime operations.
1412  * 4) Reset timers to their default value. For example after a reset it will be
1413  * possible to failover again the same master ASAP, without waiting the
1414  * failover timeout delay.
1415  * 5) In the process of doing this undo the failover if in progress.
1416  * 6) Disconnect the connections with the master (will reconnect automatically).
1417  */
1418 
1419 #define SENTINEL_RESET_NO_SENTINELS (1<<0)
1420 void sentinelResetMaster(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, int flags) {
1421  serverAssert(ri->flags & SRI_MASTER);
1422  dictRelease(ri->slaves);
1423  ri->slaves = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
1424  if (!(flags & SENTINEL_RESET_NO_SENTINELS)) {
1425  dictRelease(ri->sentinels);
1426  ri->sentinels = dictCreate(&instancesDictType,NULL);
1427  }
1428  instanceLinkCloseConnection(ri->link,ri->link->cc);
1429  instanceLinkCloseConnection(ri->link,ri->link->pc);
1430  ri->flags &= SRI_MASTER;
1431  if (ri->leader) {
1432  sdsfree(ri->leader);
1433  ri->leader = NULL;
1434  }
1435  ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE;
1436  ri->failover_state_change_time = 0;
1437  ri->failover_start_time = 0; /* We can failover again ASAP. */
1438  ri->promoted_slave = NULL;
1439  sdsfree(ri->runid);
1440  sdsfree(ri->slave_master_host);
1441  ri->runid = NULL;
1442  ri->slave_master_host = NULL;
1443  ri->link->act_ping_time = mstime();
1444  ri->link->last_ping_time = 0;
1445  ri->link->last_avail_time = mstime();
1446  ri->link->last_pong_time = mstime();
1447  ri->role_reported_time = mstime();
1448  ri->role_reported = SRI_MASTER;
1449  if (flags & SENTINEL_GENERATE_EVENT)
1450  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+reset-master",ri,"%@");
1451 }
1452 
1453 /* Call sentinelResetMaster() on every master with a name matching the specified
1454  * pattern. */
1455 int sentinelResetMastersByPattern(char *pattern, int flags) {
1456  dictIterator *di;
1457  dictEntry *de;
1458  int reset = 0;
1459 
1460  di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
1461  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1462  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1463 
1464  if (ri->name) {
1465  if (stringmatch(pattern,ri->name,0)) {
1466  sentinelResetMaster(ri,flags);
1467  reset++;
1468  }
1469  }
1470  }
1471  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1472  return reset;
1473 }
1474 
1475 /* Reset the specified master with sentinelResetMaster(), and also change
1476  * the ip:port address, but take the name of the instance unmodified.
1477  *
1478  * This is used to handle the +switch-master event.
1479  *
1480  * The function returns C_ERR if the address can't be resolved for some
1481  * reason. Otherwise C_OK is returned. */
1482 int sentinelResetMasterAndChangeAddress(sentinelRedisInstance *master, char *ip, int port) {
1483  sentinelAddr *oldaddr, *newaddr;
1484  sentinelAddr **slaves = NULL;
1485  int numslaves = 0, j;
1486  dictIterator *di;
1487  dictEntry *de;
1488 
1489  newaddr = createSentinelAddr(ip,port);
1490  if (newaddr == NULL) return C_ERR;
1491 
1492  /* Make a list of slaves to add back after the reset.
1493  * Don't include the one having the address we are switching to. */
1494  di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
1495  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1496  sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
1497 
1498  if (sentinelAddrIsEqual(slave->addr,newaddr)) continue;
1499  slaves = zrealloc(slaves,sizeof(sentinelAddr*)*(numslaves+1));
1500  slaves[numslaves++] = createSentinelAddr(slave->addr->ip,
1501  slave->addr->port);
1502  }
1503  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1504 
1505  /* If we are switching to a different address, include the old address
1506  * as a slave as well, so that we'll be able to sense / reconfigure
1507  * the old master. */
1508  if (!sentinelAddrIsEqual(newaddr,master->addr)) {
1509  slaves = zrealloc(slaves,sizeof(sentinelAddr*)*(numslaves+1));
1510  slaves[numslaves++] = createSentinelAddr(master->addr->ip,
1511  master->addr->port);
1512  }
1513 
1514  /* Reset and switch address. */
1515  sentinelResetMaster(master,SENTINEL_RESET_NO_SENTINELS);
1516  oldaddr = master->addr;
1517  master->addr = newaddr;
1518  master->o_down_since_time = 0;
1519  master->s_down_since_time = 0;
1520 
1521  /* Add slaves back. */
1522  for (j = 0; j < numslaves; j++) {
1523  sentinelRedisInstance *slave;
1524 
1525  slave = createSentinelRedisInstance(NULL,SRI_SLAVE,slaves[j]->ip,
1526  slaves[j]->port, master->quorum, master);
1527  releaseSentinelAddr(slaves[j]);
1528  if (slave) sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+slave",slave,"%@");
1529  }
1530  zfree(slaves);
1531 
1532  /* Release the old address at the end so we are safe even if the function
1533  * gets the master->addr->ip and master->addr->port as arguments. */
1534  releaseSentinelAddr(oldaddr);
1535  sentinelFlushConfig();
1536  return C_OK;
1537 }
1538 
1539 /* Return non-zero if there was no SDOWN or ODOWN error associated to this
1540  * instance in the latest 'ms' milliseconds. */
1541 int sentinelRedisInstanceNoDownFor(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, mstime_t ms) {
1542  mstime_t most_recent;
1543 
1544  most_recent = ri->s_down_since_time;
1545  if (ri->o_down_since_time > most_recent)
1546  most_recent = ri->o_down_since_time;
1547  return most_recent == 0 || (mstime() - most_recent) > ms;
1548 }
1549 
1550 /* Return the current master address, that is, its address or the address
1551  * of the promoted slave if already operational. */
1552 sentinelAddr *sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
1553  /* If we are failing over the master, and the state is already
1554  * SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES or greater, it means that we
1555  * already have the new configuration epoch in the master, and the
1556  * slave acknowledged the configuration switch. Advertise the new
1557  * address. */
1558  if ((master->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) &&
1559  master->promoted_slave &&
1560  master->failover_state >= SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES)
1561  {
1562  return master->promoted_slave->addr;
1563  } else {
1564  return master->addr;
1565  }
1566 }
1567 
1568 /* This function sets the down_after_period field value in 'master' to all
1569  * the slaves and sentinel instances connected to this master. */
1570 void sentinelPropagateDownAfterPeriod(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
1571  dictIterator *di;
1572  dictEntry *de;
1573  int j;
1574  dict *d[] = {master->slaves, master->sentinels, NULL};
1575 
1576  for (j = 0; d[j]; j++) {
1577  di = dictGetIterator(d[j]);
1578  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1579  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
1580  ri->down_after_period = master->down_after_period;
1581  }
1582  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1583  }
1584 }
1585 
1586 char *sentinelGetInstanceTypeString(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1587  if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) return "master";
1588  else if (ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) return "slave";
1589  else if (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) return "sentinel";
1590  else return "unknown";
1591 }
1592 
1593 /* This function is used in order to send commands to Redis instances: the
1594  * commands we send from Sentinel may be renamed, a common case is a master
1595  * with CONFIG and SLAVEOF commands renamed for security concerns. In that
1596  * case we check the ri->renamed_command table (or if the instance is a slave,
1597  * we check the one of the master), and map the command that we should send
1598  * to the set of renamed commads. However, if the command was not renamed,
1599  * we just return "command" itself. */
1600 char *sentinelInstanceMapCommand(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, char *command) {
1601  sds sc = sdsnew(command);
1602  if (ri->master) ri = ri->master;
1603  char *retval = dictFetchValue(ri->renamed_commands, sc);
1604  sdsfree(sc);
1605  return retval ? retval : command;
1606 }
1607 
1608 /* ============================ Config handling ============================= */
1609 char *sentinelHandleConfiguration(char **argv, int argc) {
1610  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
1611 
1612  if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"monitor") && argc == 5) {
1613  /* monitor <name> <host> <port> <quorum> */
1614  int quorum = atoi(argv[4]);
1615 
1616  if (quorum <= 0) return "Quorum must be 1 or greater.";
1617  if (createSentinelRedisInstance(argv[1],SRI_MASTER,argv[2],
1618  atoi(argv[3]),quorum,NULL) == NULL)
1619  {
1620  switch(errno) {
1621  case EBUSY: return "Duplicated master name.";
1622  case ENOENT: return "Can't resolve master instance hostname.";
1623  case EINVAL: return "Invalid port number";
1624  }
1625  }
1626  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"down-after-milliseconds") && argc == 3) {
1627  /* down-after-milliseconds <name> <milliseconds> */
1628  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1629  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1630  ri->down_after_period = atoi(argv[2]);
1631  if (ri->down_after_period <= 0)
1632  return "negative or zero time parameter.";
1633  sentinelPropagateDownAfterPeriod(ri);
1634  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"failover-timeout") && argc == 3) {
1635  /* failover-timeout <name> <milliseconds> */
1636  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1637  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1638  ri->failover_timeout = atoi(argv[2]);
1639  if (ri->failover_timeout <= 0)
1640  return "negative or zero time parameter.";
1641  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"parallel-syncs") && argc == 3) {
1642  /* parallel-syncs <name> <milliseconds> */
1643  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1644  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1645  ri->parallel_syncs = atoi(argv[2]);
1646  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"notification-script") && argc == 3) {
1647  /* notification-script <name> <path> */
1648  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1649  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1650  if (access(argv[2],X_OK) == -1)
1651  return "Notification script seems non existing or non executable.";
1652  ri->notification_script = sdsnew(argv[2]);
1653  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"client-reconfig-script") && argc == 3) {
1654  /* client-reconfig-script <name> <path> */
1655  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1656  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1657  if (access(argv[2],X_OK) == -1)
1658  return "Client reconfiguration script seems non existing or "
1659  "non executable.";
1660  ri->client_reconfig_script = sdsnew(argv[2]);
1661  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"auth-pass") && argc == 3) {
1662  /* auth-pass <name> <password> */
1663  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1664  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1665  ri->auth_pass = sdsnew(argv[2]);
1666  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"current-epoch") && argc == 2) {
1667  /* current-epoch <epoch> */
1668  unsigned long long current_epoch = strtoull(argv[1],NULL,10);
1669  if (current_epoch > sentinel.current_epoch)
1670  sentinel.current_epoch = current_epoch;
1671  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"myid") && argc == 2) {
1672  if (strlen(argv[1]) != CONFIG_RUN_ID_SIZE)
1673  return "Malformed Sentinel id in myid option.";
1674  memcpy(sentinel.myid,argv[1],CONFIG_RUN_ID_SIZE);
1675  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"config-epoch") && argc == 3) {
1676  /* config-epoch <name> <epoch> */
1677  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1678  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1679  ri->config_epoch = strtoull(argv[2],NULL,10);
1680  /* The following update of current_epoch is not really useful as
1681  * now the current epoch is persisted on the config file, but
1682  * we leave this check here for redundancy. */
1683  if (ri->config_epoch > sentinel.current_epoch)
1684  sentinel.current_epoch = ri->config_epoch;
1685  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"leader-epoch") && argc == 3) {
1686  /* leader-epoch <name> <epoch> */
1687  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1688  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1689  ri->leader_epoch = strtoull(argv[2],NULL,10);
1690  } else if ((!strcasecmp(argv[0],"known-slave") ||
1691  !strcasecmp(argv[0],"known-replica")) && argc == 4)
1692  {
1693  sentinelRedisInstance *slave;
1694 
1695  /* known-replica <name> <ip> <port> */
1696  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1697  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1698  if ((slave = createSentinelRedisInstance(NULL,SRI_SLAVE,argv[2],
1699  atoi(argv[3]), ri->quorum, ri)) == NULL)
1700  {
1701  return "Wrong hostname or port for replica.";
1702  }
1703  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"known-sentinel") &&
1704  (argc == 4 || argc == 5)) {
1705  sentinelRedisInstance *si;
1706 
1707  if (argc == 5) { /* Ignore the old form without runid. */
1708  /* known-sentinel <name> <ip> <port> [runid] */
1709  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1710  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1711  if ((si = createSentinelRedisInstance(argv[4],SRI_SENTINEL,argv[2],
1712  atoi(argv[3]), ri->quorum, ri)) == NULL)
1713  {
1714  return "Wrong hostname or port for sentinel.";
1715  }
1716  si->runid = sdsnew(argv[4]);
1717  sentinelTryConnectionSharing(si);
1718  }
1719  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"rename-command") && argc == 4) {
1720  /* rename-command <name> <command> <renamed-command> */
1721  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(argv[1]);
1722  if (!ri) return "No such master with specified name.";
1723  sds oldcmd = sdsnew(argv[2]);
1724  sds newcmd = sdsnew(argv[3]);
1725  if (dictAdd(ri->renamed_commands,oldcmd,newcmd) != DICT_OK) {
1726  sdsfree(oldcmd);
1727  sdsfree(newcmd);
1728  return "Same command renamed multiple times with rename-command.";
1729  }
1730  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"announce-ip") && argc == 2) {
1731  /* announce-ip <ip-address> */
1732  if (strlen(argv[1]))
1733  sentinel.announce_ip = sdsnew(argv[1]);
1734  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"announce-port") && argc == 2) {
1735  /* announce-port <port> */
1736  sentinel.announce_port = atoi(argv[1]);
1737  } else if (!strcasecmp(argv[0],"deny-scripts-reconfig") && argc == 2) {
1738  /* deny-scripts-reconfig <yes|no> */
1739  if ((sentinel.deny_scripts_reconfig = yesnotoi(argv[1])) == -1) {
1740  return "Please specify yes or no for the "
1741  "deny-scripts-reconfig options.";
1742  }
1743  } else {
1744  return "Unrecognized sentinel configuration statement.";
1745  }
1746  return NULL;
1747 }
1748 
1749 /* Implements CONFIG REWRITE for "sentinel" option.
1750  * This is used not just to rewrite the configuration given by the user
1751  * (the configured masters) but also in order to retain the state of
1752  * Sentinel across restarts: config epoch of masters, associated slaves
1753  * and sentinel instances, and so forth. */
1754 void rewriteConfigSentinelOption(struct rewriteConfigState *state) {
1755  dictIterator *di, *di2;
1756  dictEntry *de;
1757  sds line;
1758 
1759  /* sentinel unique ID. */
1760  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(), "sentinel myid %s", sentinel.myid);
1761  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1762 
1763  /* sentinel deny-scripts-reconfig. */
1764  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(), "sentinel deny-scripts-reconfig %s",
1765  sentinel.deny_scripts_reconfig ? "yes" : "no");
1766  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,
1767  sentinel.deny_scripts_reconfig != SENTINEL_DEFAULT_DENY_SCRIPTS_RECONFIG);
1768 
1769  /* For every master emit a "sentinel monitor" config entry. */
1770  di = dictGetIterator(sentinel.masters);
1771  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
1772  sentinelRedisInstance *master, *ri;
1773  sentinelAddr *master_addr;
1774 
1775  /* sentinel monitor */
1776  master = dictGetVal(de);
1777  master_addr = sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress(master);
1778  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"sentinel monitor %s %s %d %d",
1779  master->name, master_addr->ip, master_addr->port,
1780  master->quorum);
1781  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1782 
1783  /* sentinel down-after-milliseconds */
1784  if (master->down_after_period != SENTINEL_DEFAULT_DOWN_AFTER) {
1785  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1786  "sentinel down-after-milliseconds %s %ld",
1787  master->name, (long) master->down_after_period);
1788  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1789  }
1790 
1791  /* sentinel failover-timeout */
1792  if (master->failover_timeout != SENTINEL_DEFAULT_FAILOVER_TIMEOUT) {
1793  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1794  "sentinel failover-timeout %s %ld",
1795  master->name, (long) master->failover_timeout);
1796  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1797  }
1798 
1799  /* sentinel parallel-syncs */
1800  if (master->parallel_syncs != SENTINEL_DEFAULT_PARALLEL_SYNCS) {
1801  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1802  "sentinel parallel-syncs %s %d",
1803  master->name, master->parallel_syncs);
1804  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1805  }
1806 
1807  /* sentinel notification-script */
1808  if (master->notification_script) {
1809  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1810  "sentinel notification-script %s %s",
1811  master->name, master->notification_script);
1812  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1813  }
1814 
1815  /* sentinel client-reconfig-script */
1816  if (master->client_reconfig_script) {
1817  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1818  "sentinel client-reconfig-script %s %s",
1819  master->name, master->client_reconfig_script);
1820  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1821  }
1822 
1823  /* sentinel auth-pass */
1824  if (master->auth_pass) {
1825  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1826  "sentinel auth-pass %s %s",
1827  master->name, master->auth_pass);
1828  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1829  }
1830 
1831  /* sentinel config-epoch */
1832  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1833  "sentinel config-epoch %s %llu",
1834  master->name, (unsigned long long) master->config_epoch);
1835  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1836 
1837  /* sentinel leader-epoch */
1838  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1839  "sentinel leader-epoch %s %llu",
1840  master->name, (unsigned long long) master->leader_epoch);
1841  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1842 
1843  /* sentinel known-slave */
1844  di2 = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
1845  while((de = dictNext(di2)) != NULL) {
1846  sentinelAddr *slave_addr;
1847 
1848  ri = dictGetVal(de);
1849  slave_addr = ri->addr;
1850 
1851  /* If master_addr (obtained using sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress()
1852  * so it may be the address of the promoted slave) is equal to this
1853  * slave's address, a failover is in progress and the slave was
1854  * already successfully promoted. So as the address of this slave
1855  * we use the old master address instead. */
1856  if (sentinelAddrIsEqual(slave_addr,master_addr))
1857  slave_addr = master->addr;
1858  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1859  "sentinel known-replica %s %s %d",
1860  master->name, slave_addr->ip, slave_addr->port);
1861  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1862  }
1863  dictReleaseIterator(di2);
1864 
1865  /* sentinel known-sentinel */
1866  di2 = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
1867  while((de = dictNext(di2)) != NULL) {
1868  ri = dictGetVal(de);
1869  if (ri->runid == NULL) continue;
1870  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1871  "sentinel known-sentinel %s %s %d %s",
1872  master->name, ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port, ri->runid);
1873  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1874  }
1875  dictReleaseIterator(di2);
1876 
1877  /* sentinel rename-command */
1878  di2 = dictGetIterator(master->renamed_commands);
1879  while((de = dictNext(di2)) != NULL) {
1880  sds oldname = dictGetKey(de);
1881  sds newname = dictGetVal(de);
1882  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1883  "sentinel rename-command %s %s %s",
1884  master->name, oldname, newname);
1885  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1886  }
1887  dictReleaseIterator(di2);
1888  }
1889 
1890  /* sentinel current-epoch is a global state valid for all the masters. */
1891  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
1892  "sentinel current-epoch %llu", (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch);
1893  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1894 
1895  /* sentinel announce-ip. */
1896  if (sentinel.announce_ip) {
1897  line = sdsnew("sentinel announce-ip ");
1898  line = sdscatrepr(line, sentinel.announce_ip, sdslen(sentinel.announce_ip));
1899  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1900  }
1901 
1902  /* sentinel announce-port. */
1903  if (sentinel.announce_port) {
1904  line = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"sentinel announce-port %d",
1905  sentinel.announce_port);
1906  rewriteConfigRewriteLine(state,"sentinel",line,1);
1907  }
1908 
1909  dictReleaseIterator(di);
1910 }
1911 
1912 /* This function uses the config rewriting Redis engine in order to persist
1913  * the state of the Sentinel in the current configuration file.
1914  *
1915  * Before returning the function calls fsync() against the generated
1916  * configuration file to make sure changes are committed to disk.
1917  *
1918  * On failure the function logs a warning on the Redis log. */
1919 void sentinelFlushConfig(void) {
1920  int fd = -1;
1921  int saved_hz = server.hz;
1922  int rewrite_status;
1923 
1924  server.hz = CONFIG_DEFAULT_HZ;
1925  rewrite_status = rewriteConfig(server.configfile);
1926  server.hz = saved_hz;
1927 
1928  if (rewrite_status == -1) goto werr;
1929  if ((fd = open(server.configfile,O_RDONLY)) == -1) goto werr;
1930  if (fsync(fd) == -1) goto werr;
1931  if (close(fd) == EOF) goto werr;
1932  return;
1933 
1934 werr:
1935  if (fd != -1) close(fd);
1936  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"WARNING: Sentinel was not able to save the new configuration on disk!!!: %s", strerror(errno));
1937 }
1938 
1939 /* ====================== hiredis connection handling ======================= */
1940 
1941 /* Send the AUTH command with the specified master password if needed.
1942  * Note that for slaves the password set for the master is used.
1943  *
1944  * We don't check at all if the command was successfully transmitted
1945  * to the instance as if it fails Sentinel will detect the instance down,
1946  * will disconnect and reconnect the link and so forth. */
1947 void sentinelSendAuthIfNeeded(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, redisAsyncContext *c) {
1948  char *auth_pass = (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) ? ri->auth_pass :
1949  ri->master->auth_pass;
1950 
1951  if (auth_pass) {
1952  if (redisAsyncCommand(c, sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, ri, "%s %s",
1953  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"AUTH"),
1954  auth_pass) == C_OK) ri->link->pending_commands++;
1955  }
1956 }
1957 
1958 /* Use CLIENT SETNAME to name the connection in the Redis instance as
1959  * sentinel-<first_8_chars_of_runid>-<connection_type>
1960  * The connection type is "cmd" or "pubsub" as specified by 'type'.
1961  *
1962  * This makes it possible to list all the sentinel instances connected
1963  * to a Redis servewr with CLIENT LIST, grepping for a specific name format. */
1964 void sentinelSetClientName(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, redisAsyncContext *c, char *type) {
1965  char name[64];
1966 
1967  snprintf(name,sizeof(name),"sentinel-%.8s-%s",sentinel.myid,type);
1968  if (redisAsyncCommand(c, sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, ri,
1969  "%s SETNAME %s",
1970  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"CLIENT"),
1971  name) == C_OK)
1972  {
1973  ri->link->pending_commands++;
1974  }
1975 }
1976 
1977 /* Create the async connections for the instance link if the link
1978  * is disconnected. Note that link->disconnected is true even if just
1979  * one of the two links (commands and pub/sub) is missing. */
1980 void sentinelReconnectInstance(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
1981  if (ri->link->disconnected == 0) return;
1982  if (ri->addr->port == 0) return; /* port == 0 means invalid address. */
1983  instanceLink *link = ri->link;
1984  mstime_t now = mstime();
1985 
1986  if (now - ri->link->last_reconn_time < SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD) return;
1987  ri->link->last_reconn_time = now;
1988 
1989  /* Commands connection. */
1990  if (link->cc == NULL) {
1991  link->cc = redisAsyncConnectBind(ri->addr->ip,ri->addr->port,NET_FIRST_BIND_ADDR);
1992  if (link->cc->err) {
1993  sentinelEvent(LL_DEBUG,"-cmd-link-reconnection",ri,"%@ #%s",
1994  link->cc->errstr);
1995  instanceLinkCloseConnection(link,link->cc);
1996  } else {
1997  link->pending_commands = 0;
1998  link->cc_conn_time = mstime();
1999  link->cc->data = link;
2000  redisAeAttach(server.el,link->cc);
2001  redisAsyncSetConnectCallback(link->cc,
2002  sentinelLinkEstablishedCallback);
2003  redisAsyncSetDisconnectCallback(link->cc,
2004  sentinelDisconnectCallback);
2005  sentinelSendAuthIfNeeded(ri,link->cc);
2006  sentinelSetClientName(ri,link->cc,"cmd");
2007 
2008  /* Send a PING ASAP when reconnecting. */
2009  sentinelSendPing(ri);
2010  }
2011  }
2012  /* Pub / Sub */
2013  if ((ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE)) && link->pc == NULL) {
2014  link->pc = redisAsyncConnectBind(ri->addr->ip,ri->addr->port,NET_FIRST_BIND_ADDR);
2015  if (link->pc->err) {
2016  sentinelEvent(LL_DEBUG,"-pubsub-link-reconnection",ri,"%@ #%s",
2017  link->pc->errstr);
2018  instanceLinkCloseConnection(link,link->pc);
2019  } else {
2020  int retval;
2021 
2022  link->pc_conn_time = mstime();
2023  link->pc->data = link;
2024  redisAeAttach(server.el,link->pc);
2025  redisAsyncSetConnectCallback(link->pc,
2026  sentinelLinkEstablishedCallback);
2027  redisAsyncSetDisconnectCallback(link->pc,
2028  sentinelDisconnectCallback);
2029  sentinelSendAuthIfNeeded(ri,link->pc);
2030  sentinelSetClientName(ri,link->pc,"pubsub");
2031  /* Now we subscribe to the Sentinels "Hello" channel. */
2032  retval = redisAsyncCommand(link->pc,
2033  sentinelReceiveHelloMessages, ri, "%s %s",
2034  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"SUBSCRIBE"),
2035  SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL);
2036  if (retval != C_OK) {
2037  /* If we can't subscribe, the Pub/Sub connection is useless
2038  * and we can simply disconnect it and try again. */
2039  instanceLinkCloseConnection(link,link->pc);
2040  return;
2041  }
2042  }
2043  }
2044  /* Clear the disconnected status only if we have both the connections
2045  * (or just the commands connection if this is a sentinel instance). */
2046  if (link->cc && (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL || link->pc))
2047  link->disconnected = 0;
2048 }
2049 
2050 /* ======================== Redis instances pinging ======================== */
2051 
2052 /* Return true if master looks "sane", that is:
2053  * 1) It is actually a master in the current configuration.
2054  * 2) It reports itself as a master.
2055  * 3) It is not SDOWN or ODOWN.
2056  * 4) We obtained last INFO no more than two times the INFO period time ago. */
2057 int sentinelMasterLooksSane(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
2058  return
2059  master->flags & SRI_MASTER &&
2060  master->role_reported == SRI_MASTER &&
2061  (master->flags & (SRI_S_DOWN|SRI_O_DOWN)) == 0 &&
2062  (mstime() - master->info_refresh) < SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD*2;
2063 }
2064 
2065 /* Process the INFO output from masters. */
2066 void sentinelRefreshInstanceInfo(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, const char *info) {
2067  sds *lines;
2068  int numlines, j;
2069  int role = 0;
2070 
2071  /* cache full INFO output for instance */
2072  sdsfree(ri->info);
2073  ri->info = sdsnew(info);
2074 
2075  /* The following fields must be reset to a given value in the case they
2076  * are not found at all in the INFO output. */
2077  ri->master_link_down_time = 0;
2078 
2079  /* Process line by line. */
2080  lines = sdssplitlen(info,strlen(info),"\r\n",2,&numlines);
2081  for (j = 0; j < numlines; j++) {
2082  sentinelRedisInstance *slave;
2083  sds l = lines[j];
2084 
2085  /* run_id:<40 hex chars>*/
2086  if (sdslen(l) >= 47 && !memcmp(l,"run_id:",7)) {
2087  if (ri->runid == NULL) {
2088  ri->runid = sdsnewlen(l+7,40);
2089  } else {
2090  if (strncmp(ri->runid,l+7,40) != 0) {
2091  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+reboot",ri,"%@");
2092  sdsfree(ri->runid);
2093  ri->runid = sdsnewlen(l+7,40);
2094  }
2095  }
2096  }
2097 
2098  /* old versions: slave0:<ip>,<port>,<state>
2099  * new versions: slave0:ip=127.0.0.1,port=9999,... */
2100  if ((ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) &&
2101  sdslen(l) >= 7 &&
2102  !memcmp(l,"slave",5) && isdigit(l[5]))
2103  {
2104  char *ip, *port, *end;
2105 
2106  if (strstr(l,"ip=") == NULL) {
2107  /* Old format. */
2108  ip = strchr(l,':'); if (!ip) continue;
2109  ip++; /* Now ip points to start of ip address. */
2110  port = strchr(ip,','); if (!port) continue;
2111  *port = '\0'; /* nul term for easy access. */
2112  port++; /* Now port points to start of port number. */
2113  end = strchr(port,','); if (!end) continue;
2114  *end = '\0'; /* nul term for easy access. */
2115  } else {
2116  /* New format. */
2117  ip = strstr(l,"ip="); if (!ip) continue;
2118  ip += 3; /* Now ip points to start of ip address. */
2119  port = strstr(l,"port="); if (!port) continue;
2120  port += 5; /* Now port points to start of port number. */
2121  /* Nul term both fields for easy access. */
2122  end = strchr(ip,','); if (end) *end = '\0';
2123  end = strchr(port,','); if (end) *end = '\0';
2124  }
2125 
2126  /* Check if we already have this slave into our table,
2127  * otherwise add it. */
2128  if (sentinelRedisInstanceLookupSlave(ri,ip,atoi(port)) == NULL) {
2129  if ((slave = createSentinelRedisInstance(NULL,SRI_SLAVE,ip,
2130  atoi(port), ri->quorum, ri)) != NULL)
2131  {
2132  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+slave",slave,"%@");
2133  sentinelFlushConfig();
2134  }
2135  }
2136  }
2137 
2138  /* master_link_down_since_seconds:<seconds> */
2139  if (sdslen(l) >= 32 &&
2140  !memcmp(l,"master_link_down_since_seconds",30))
2141  {
2142  ri->master_link_down_time = strtoll(l+31,NULL,10)*1000;
2143  }
2144 
2145  /* role:<role> */
2146  if (!memcmp(l,"role:master",11)) role = SRI_MASTER;
2147  else if (!memcmp(l,"role:slave",10)) role = SRI_SLAVE;
2148 
2149  if (role == SRI_SLAVE) {
2150  /* master_host:<host> */
2151  if (sdslen(l) >= 12 && !memcmp(l,"master_host:",12)) {
2152  if (ri->slave_master_host == NULL ||
2153  strcasecmp(l+12,ri->slave_master_host))
2154  {
2155  sdsfree(ri->slave_master_host);
2156  ri->slave_master_host = sdsnew(l+12);
2157  ri->slave_conf_change_time = mstime();
2158  }
2159  }
2160 
2161  /* master_port:<port> */
2162  if (sdslen(l) >= 12 && !memcmp(l,"master_port:",12)) {
2163  int slave_master_port = atoi(l+12);
2164 
2165  if (ri->slave_master_port != slave_master_port) {
2166  ri->slave_master_port = slave_master_port;
2167  ri->slave_conf_change_time = mstime();
2168  }
2169  }
2170 
2171  /* master_link_status:<status> */
2172  if (sdslen(l) >= 19 && !memcmp(l,"master_link_status:",19)) {
2173  ri->slave_master_link_status =
2174  (strcasecmp(l+19,"up") == 0) ?
2175  SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_UP :
2176  SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_DOWN;
2177  }
2178 
2179  /* slave_priority:<priority> */
2180  if (sdslen(l) >= 15 && !memcmp(l,"slave_priority:",15))
2181  ri->slave_priority = atoi(l+15);
2182 
2183  /* slave_repl_offset:<offset> */
2184  if (sdslen(l) >= 18 && !memcmp(l,"slave_repl_offset:",18))
2185  ri->slave_repl_offset = strtoull(l+18,NULL,10);
2186  }
2187  }
2188  ri->info_refresh = mstime();
2189  sdsfreesplitres(lines,numlines);
2190 
2191  /* ---------------------------- Acting half -----------------------------
2192  * Some things will not happen if sentinel.tilt is true, but some will
2193  * still be processed. */
2194 
2195  /* Remember when the role changed. */
2196  if (role != ri->role_reported) {
2197  ri->role_reported_time = mstime();
2198  ri->role_reported = role;
2199  if (role == SRI_SLAVE) ri->slave_conf_change_time = mstime();
2200  /* Log the event with +role-change if the new role is coherent or
2201  * with -role-change if there is a mismatch with the current config. */
2202  sentinelEvent(LL_VERBOSE,
2203  ((ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE)) == role) ?
2204  "+role-change" : "-role-change",
2205  ri, "%@ new reported role is %s",
2206  role == SRI_MASTER ? "master" : "slave",
2207  ri->flags & SRI_MASTER ? "master" : "slave");
2208  }
2209 
2210  /* None of the following conditions are processed when in tilt mode, so
2211  * return asap. */
2212  if (sentinel.tilt) return;
2213 
2214  /* Handle master -> slave role switch. */
2215  if ((ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) && role == SRI_SLAVE) {
2216  /* Nothing to do, but masters claiming to be slaves are
2217  * considered to be unreachable by Sentinel, so eventually
2218  * a failover will be triggered. */
2219  }
2220 
2221  /* Handle slave -> master role switch. */
2222  if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) && role == SRI_MASTER) {
2223  /* If this is a promoted slave we can change state to the
2224  * failover state machine. */
2225  if ((ri->flags & SRI_PROMOTED) &&
2226  (ri->master->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) &&
2227  (ri->master->failover_state ==
2228  SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION))
2229  {
2230  /* Now that we are sure the slave was reconfigured as a master
2231  * set the master configuration epoch to the epoch we won the
2232  * election to perform this failover. This will force the other
2233  * Sentinels to update their config (assuming there is not
2234  * a newer one already available). */
2235  ri->master->config_epoch = ri->master->failover_epoch;
2236  ri->master->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES;
2237  ri->master->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
2238  sentinelFlushConfig();
2239  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+promoted-slave",ri,"%@");
2240  if (sentinel.simfailure_flags &
2241  SENTINEL_SIMFAILURE_CRASH_AFTER_PROMOTION)
2242  sentinelSimFailureCrash();
2243  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+failover-state-reconf-slaves",
2244  ri->master,"%@");
2245  sentinelCallClientReconfScript(ri->master,SENTINEL_LEADER,
2246  "start",ri->master->addr,ri->addr);
2247  sentinelForceHelloUpdateForMaster(ri->master);
2248  } else {
2249  /* A slave turned into a master. We want to force our view and
2250  * reconfigure as slave. Wait some time after the change before
2251  * going forward, to receive new configs if any. */
2252  mstime_t wait_time = SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD*4;
2253 
2254  if (!(ri->flags & SRI_PROMOTED) &&
2255  sentinelMasterLooksSane(ri->master) &&
2256  sentinelRedisInstanceNoDownFor(ri,wait_time) &&
2257  mstime() - ri->role_reported_time > wait_time)
2258  {
2259  int retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(ri,
2260  ri->master->addr->ip,
2261  ri->master->addr->port);
2262  if (retval == C_OK)
2263  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+convert-to-slave",ri,"%@");
2264  }
2265  }
2266  }
2267 
2268  /* Handle slaves replicating to a different master address. */
2269  if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) &&
2270  role == SRI_SLAVE &&
2271  (ri->slave_master_port != ri->master->addr->port ||
2272  strcasecmp(ri->slave_master_host,ri->master->addr->ip)))
2273  {
2274  mstime_t wait_time = ri->master->failover_timeout;
2275 
2276  /* Make sure the master is sane before reconfiguring this instance
2277  * into a slave. */
2278  if (sentinelMasterLooksSane(ri->master) &&
2279  sentinelRedisInstanceNoDownFor(ri,wait_time) &&
2280  mstime() - ri->slave_conf_change_time > wait_time)
2281  {
2282  int retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(ri,
2283  ri->master->addr->ip,
2284  ri->master->addr->port);
2285  if (retval == C_OK)
2286  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+fix-slave-config",ri,"%@");
2287  }
2288  }
2289 
2290  /* Detect if the slave that is in the process of being reconfigured
2291  * changed state. */
2292  if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) && role == SRI_SLAVE &&
2293  (ri->flags & (SRI_RECONF_SENT|SRI_RECONF_INPROG)))
2294  {
2295  /* SRI_RECONF_SENT -> SRI_RECONF_INPROG. */
2296  if ((ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_SENT) &&
2297  ri->slave_master_host &&
2298  strcmp(ri->slave_master_host,
2299  ri->master->promoted_slave->addr->ip) == 0 &&
2300  ri->slave_master_port == ri->master->promoted_slave->addr->port)
2301  {
2302  ri->flags &= ~SRI_RECONF_SENT;
2303  ri->flags |= SRI_RECONF_INPROG;
2304  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+slave-reconf-inprog",ri,"%@");
2305  }
2306 
2307  /* SRI_RECONF_INPROG -> SRI_RECONF_DONE */
2308  if ((ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_INPROG) &&
2309  ri->slave_master_link_status == SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_UP)
2310  {
2311  ri->flags &= ~SRI_RECONF_INPROG;
2312  ri->flags |= SRI_RECONF_DONE;
2313  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+slave-reconf-done",ri,"%@");
2314  }
2315  }
2316 }

2318 void sentinelInfoReplyCallback(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2319  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = privdata;
2320  instanceLink *link = c->data;
2321  redisReply *r;
2322 
2323  if (!reply || !link) return;
2324  link->pending_commands--;
2325  r = reply;
2326 
2327  if (r->type == REDIS_REPLY_STRING)
2328  sentinelRefreshInstanceInfo(ri,r->str);
2329 }

2331 /* Just discard the reply. We use this when we are not monitoring the return
2332  * value of the command but its effects directly. */
2333 void sentinelDiscardReplyCallback(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2334  instanceLink *link = c->data;
2335  UNUSED(reply);
2336  UNUSED(privdata);
2337 
2338  if (link) link->pending_commands--;
2339 }
