2341 void sentinelPingReplyCallback(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2342  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = privdata;
2343  instanceLink *link = c->data;
2344  redisReply *r;
2345 
2346  if (!reply || !link) return;
2347  link->pending_commands--;
2348  r = reply;
2349 
2350  if (r->type == REDIS_REPLY_STATUS ||
2351  r->type == REDIS_REPLY_ERROR) {
2352  /* Update the "instance available" field only if this is an
2353  * acceptable reply. */
2354  if (strncmp(r->str,"PONG",4) == 0 ||
2355  strncmp(r->str,"LOADING",7) == 0 ||
2356  strncmp(r->str,"MASTERDOWN",10) == 0)
2357  {
2358  link->last_avail_time = mstime();
2359  link->act_ping_time = 0; /* Flag the pong as received. */
2360  } else {
2361  /* Send a SCRIPT KILL command if the instance appears to be
2362  * down because of a busy script. */
2363  if (strncmp(r->str,"BUSY",4) == 0 &&
2364  (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) &&
2365  !(ri->flags & SRI_SCRIPT_KILL_SENT))
2366  {
2367  if (redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
2368  sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, ri,
2369  "%s KILL",
2370  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"SCRIPT")) == C_OK)
2371  {
2372  ri->link->pending_commands++;
2373  }
2374  ri->flags |= SRI_SCRIPT_KILL_SENT;
2375  }
2376  }
2377  }
2378  link->last_pong_time = mstime();
2379 }
2380 
2381 /* This is called when we get the reply about the PUBLISH command we send
2382  * to the master to advertise this sentinel. */
2383 void sentinelPublishReplyCallback(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2384  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = privdata;
2385  instanceLink *link = c->data;
2386  redisReply *r;
2387 
2388  if (!reply || !link) return;
2389  link->pending_commands--;
2390  r = reply;
2391 
2392  /* Only update pub_time if we actually published our message. Otherwise
2393  * we'll retry again in 100 milliseconds. */
2394  if (r->type != REDIS_REPLY_ERROR)
2395  ri->last_pub_time = mstime();
2396 }
2397 
2398 /* Process an hello message received via Pub/Sub in master or slave instance,
2399  * or sent directly to this sentinel via the (fake) PUBLISH command of Sentinel.
2400  *
2401  * If the master name specified in the message is not known, the message is
2402  * discarded. */
2403 void sentinelProcessHelloMessage(char *hello, int hello_len) {
2404  /* Format is composed of 8 tokens:
2405  * 0=ip,1=port,2=runid,3=current_epoch,4=master_name,
2406  * 5=master_ip,6=master_port,7=master_config_epoch. */
2407  int numtokens, port, removed, master_port;
2408  uint64_t current_epoch, master_config_epoch;
2409  char **token = sdssplitlen(hello, hello_len, ",", 1, &numtokens);
2410  sentinelRedisInstance *si, *master;
2411 
2412  if (numtokens == 8) {
2413  /* Obtain a reference to the master this hello message is about */
2414  master = sentinelGetMasterByName(token[4]);
2415  if (!master) goto cleanup; /* Unknown master, skip the message. */
2416 
2417  /* First, try to see if we already have this sentinel. */
2418  port = atoi(token[1]);
2419  master_port = atoi(token[6]);
2420  si = getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(
2421  master->sentinels,token[0],port,token[2]);
2422  current_epoch = strtoull(token[3],NULL,10);
2423  master_config_epoch = strtoull(token[7],NULL,10);
2424 
2425  if (!si) {
2426  /* If not, remove all the sentinels that have the same runid
2427  * because there was an address change, and add the same Sentinel
2428  * with the new address back. */
2429  removed = removeMatchingSentinelFromMaster(master,token[2]);
2430  if (removed) {
2431  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+sentinel-address-switch",master,
2432  "%@ ip %s port %d for %s", token[0],port,token[2]);
2433  } else {
2434  /* Check if there is another Sentinel with the same address this
2435  * new one is reporting. What we do if this happens is to set its
2436  * port to 0, to signal the address is invalid. We'll update it
2437  * later if we get an HELLO message. */
2438  sentinelRedisInstance *other =
2439  getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(
2440  master->sentinels, token[0],port,NULL);
2441  if (other) {
2442  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+sentinel-invalid-addr",other,"%@");
2443  other->addr->port = 0; /* It means: invalid address. */
2444  sentinelUpdateSentinelAddressInAllMasters(other);
2445  }
2446  }
2447 
2448  /* Add the new sentinel. */
2449  si = createSentinelRedisInstance(token[2],SRI_SENTINEL,
2450  token[0],port,master->quorum,master);
2451 
2452  if (si) {
2453  if (!removed) sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+sentinel",si,"%@");
2454  /* The runid is NULL after a new instance creation and
2455  * for Sentinels we don't have a later chance to fill it,
2456  * so do it now. */
2457  si->runid = sdsnew(token[2]);
2458  sentinelTryConnectionSharing(si);
2459  if (removed) sentinelUpdateSentinelAddressInAllMasters(si);
2460  sentinelFlushConfig();
2461  }
2462  }
2463 
2464  /* Update local current_epoch if received current_epoch is greater.*/
2465  if (current_epoch > sentinel.current_epoch) {
2466  sentinel.current_epoch = current_epoch;
2467  sentinelFlushConfig();
2468  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+new-epoch",master,"%llu",
2469  (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch);
2470  }
2471 
2472  /* Update master info if received configuration is newer. */
2473  if (si && master->config_epoch < master_config_epoch) {
2474  master->config_epoch = master_config_epoch;
2475  if (master_port != master->addr->port ||
2476  strcmp(master->addr->ip, token[5]))
2477  {
2478  sentinelAddr *old_addr;
2479 
2480  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+config-update-from",si,"%@");
2481  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+switch-master",
2482  master,"%s %s %d %s %d",
2483  master->name,
2484  master->addr->ip, master->addr->port,
2485  token[5], master_port);
2486 
2487  old_addr = dupSentinelAddr(master->addr);
2488  sentinelResetMasterAndChangeAddress(master, token[5], master_port);
2489  sentinelCallClientReconfScript(master,
2490  SENTINEL_OBSERVER,"start",
2491  old_addr,master->addr);
2492  releaseSentinelAddr(old_addr);
2493  }
2494  }
2495 
2496  /* Update the state of the Sentinel. */
2497  if (si) si->last_hello_time = mstime();
2498  }
2499 
2500 cleanup:
2501  sdsfreesplitres(token,numtokens);
2502 }
2503 
2504 
2505 /* This is our Pub/Sub callback for the Hello channel. It's useful in order
2506  * to discover other sentinels attached at the same master. */
2507 void sentinelReceiveHelloMessages(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
2508  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = privdata;
2509  redisReply *r;
2510  UNUSED(c);
2511 
2512  if (!reply || !ri) return;
2513  r = reply;
2514 
2515  /* Update the last activity in the pubsub channel. Note that since we
2516  * receive our messages as well this timestamp can be used to detect
2517  * if the link is probably disconnected even if it seems otherwise. */
2518  ri->link->pc_last_activity = mstime();
2519 
2520  /* Sanity check in the reply we expect, so that the code that follows
2521  * can avoid to check for details. */
2522  if (r->type != REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY ||
2523  r->elements != 3 ||
2524  r->element[0]->type != REDIS_REPLY_STRING ||
2525  r->element[1]->type != REDIS_REPLY_STRING ||
2526  r->element[2]->type != REDIS_REPLY_STRING ||
2527  strcmp(r->element[0]->str,"message") != 0) return;
2528 
2529  /* We are not interested in meeting ourselves */
2530  if (strstr(r->element[2]->str,sentinel.myid) != NULL) return;
2531 
2532  sentinelProcessHelloMessage(r->element[2]->str, r->element[2]->len);
2533 }
2534 
2535 /* Send an "Hello" message via Pub/Sub to the specified 'ri' Redis
2536  * instance in order to broadcast the current configuration for this
2537  * master, and to advertise the existence of this Sentinel at the same time.
2538  *
2539  * The message has the following format:
2540  *
2541  * sentinel_ip,sentinel_port,sentinel_runid,current_epoch,
2542  * master_name,master_ip,master_port,master_config_epoch.
2543  *
2544  * Returns C_OK if the PUBLISH was queued correctly, otherwise
2545  * C_ERR is returned. */
2546 int sentinelSendHello(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2547  char ip[NET_IP_STR_LEN];
2548  char payload[NET_IP_STR_LEN+1024];
2549  int retval;
2550  char *announce_ip;
2551  int announce_port;
2552  sentinelRedisInstance *master = (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) ? ri : ri->master;
2553  sentinelAddr *master_addr = sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress(master);
2554 
2555  if (ri->link->disconnected) return C_ERR;
2556 
2557  /* Use the specified announce address if specified, otherwise try to
2558  * obtain our own IP address. */
2559  if (sentinel.announce_ip) {
2560  announce_ip = sentinel.announce_ip;
2561  } else {
2562  if (anetSockName(ri->link->cc->c.fd,ip,sizeof(ip),NULL) == -1)
2563  return C_ERR;
2564  announce_ip = ip;
2565  }
2566  announce_port = sentinel.announce_port ?
2567  sentinel.announce_port : server.port;
2568 
2569  /* Format and send the Hello message. */
2570  snprintf(payload,sizeof(payload),
2571  "%s,%d,%s,%llu," /* Info about this sentinel. */
2572  "%s,%s,%d,%llu", /* Info about current master. */
2573  announce_ip, announce_port, sentinel.myid,
2574  (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch,
2575  /* --- */
2576  master->name,master_addr->ip,master_addr->port,
2577  (unsigned long long) master->config_epoch);
2578  retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
2579  sentinelPublishReplyCallback, ri, "%s %s %s",
2580  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"PUBLISH"),
2581  SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL,payload);
2582  if (retval != C_OK) return C_ERR;
2583  ri->link->pending_commands++;
2584  return C_OK;
2585 }
2586 
2587 /* Reset last_pub_time in all the instances in the specified dictionary
2588  * in order to force the delivery of an Hello update ASAP. */
2589 void sentinelForceHelloUpdateDictOfRedisInstances(dict *instances) {
2590  dictIterator *di;
2591  dictEntry *de;
2592 
2593  di = dictGetSafeIterator(instances);
2594  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2595  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
2596  if (ri->last_pub_time >= (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD+1))
2597  ri->last_pub_time -= (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD+1);
2598  }
2599  dictReleaseIterator(di);
2600 }
2601 
2602 /* This function forces the delivery of an "Hello" message (see
2603  * sentinelSendHello() top comment for further information) to all the Redis
2604  * and Sentinel instances related to the specified 'master'.
2605  *
2606  * It is technically not needed since we send an update to every instance
2607  * with a period of SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD milliseconds, however when a
2608  * Sentinel upgrades a configuration it is a good idea to deliever an update
2609  * to the other Sentinels ASAP. */
2610 int sentinelForceHelloUpdateForMaster(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
2611  if (!(master->flags & SRI_MASTER)) return C_ERR;
2612  if (master->last_pub_time >= (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD+1))
2613  master->last_pub_time -= (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD+1);
2614  sentinelForceHelloUpdateDictOfRedisInstances(master->sentinels);
2615  sentinelForceHelloUpdateDictOfRedisInstances(master->slaves);
2616  return C_OK;
2617 }
2618 
2619 /* Send a PING to the specified instance and refresh the act_ping_time
2620  * if it is zero (that is, if we received a pong for the previous ping).
2621  *
2622  * On error zero is returned, and we can't consider the PING command
2623  * queued in the connection. */
2624 int sentinelSendPing(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2625  int retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
2626  sentinelPingReplyCallback, ri, "%s",
2627  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"PING"));
2628  if (retval == C_OK) {
2629  ri->link->pending_commands++;
2630  ri->link->last_ping_time = mstime();
2631  /* We update the active ping time only if we received the pong for
2632  * the previous ping, otherwise we are technically waiting since the
2633  * first ping that did not receive a reply. */
2634  if (ri->link->act_ping_time == 0)
2635  ri->link->act_ping_time = ri->link->last_ping_time;
2636  return 1;
2637  } else {
2638  return 0;
2639  }
2640 }
2641 
2642 /* Send periodic PING, INFO, and PUBLISH to the Hello channel to
2643  * the specified master or slave instance. */
2644 void sentinelSendPeriodicCommands(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2645  mstime_t now = mstime();
2646  mstime_t info_period, ping_period;
2647  int retval;
2648 
2649  /* Return ASAP if we have already a PING or INFO already pending, or
2650  * in the case the instance is not properly connected. */
2651  if (ri->link->disconnected) return;
2652 
2653  /* For INFO, PING, PUBLISH that are not critical commands to send we
2654  * also have a limit of SENTINEL_MAX_PENDING_COMMANDS. We don't
2655  * want to use a lot of memory just because a link is not working
2656  * properly (note that anyway there is a redundant protection about this,
2657  * that is, the link will be disconnected and reconnected if a long
2658  * timeout condition is detected. */
2659  if (ri->link->pending_commands >=
2660  SENTINEL_MAX_PENDING_COMMANDS * ri->link->refcount) return;
2661 
2662  /* If this is a slave of a master in O_DOWN condition we start sending
2663  * it INFO every second, instead of the usual SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD
2664  * period. In this state we want to closely monitor slaves in case they
2665  * are turned into masters by another Sentinel, or by the sysadmin.
2666  *
2667  * Similarly we monitor the INFO output more often if the slave reports
2668  * to be disconnected from the master, so that we can have a fresh
2669  * disconnection time figure. */
2670  if ((ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) &&
2671  ((ri->master->flags & (SRI_O_DOWN|SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS)) ||
2672  (ri->master_link_down_time != 0)))
2673  {
2674  info_period = 1000;
2675  } else {
2676  info_period = SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD;
2677  }
2678 
2679  /* We ping instances every time the last received pong is older than
2680  * the configured 'down-after-milliseconds' time, but every second
2681  * anyway if 'down-after-milliseconds' is greater than 1 second. */
2682  ping_period = ri->down_after_period;
2683  if (ping_period > SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD) ping_period = SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD;
2684 
2685  /* Send INFO to masters and slaves, not sentinels. */
2686  if ((ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) == 0 &&
2687  (ri->info_refresh == 0 ||
2688  (now - ri->info_refresh) > info_period))
2689  {
2690  retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
2691  sentinelInfoReplyCallback, ri, "%s",
2692  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"INFO"));
2693  if (retval == C_OK) ri->link->pending_commands++;
2694  }
2695 
2696  /* Send PING to all the three kinds of instances. */
2697  if ((now - ri->link->last_pong_time) > ping_period &&
2698  (now - ri->link->last_ping_time) > ping_period/2) {
2699  sentinelSendPing(ri);
2700  }
2701 
2702  /* PUBLISH hello messages to all the three kinds of instances. */
2703  if ((now - ri->last_pub_time) > SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD) {
2704  sentinelSendHello(ri);
2705  }
2706 }
2707 
2708 /* =========================== SENTINEL command ============================= */
2709 
2710 const char *sentinelFailoverStateStr(int state) {
2711  switch(state) {
2712  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE: return "none";
2713  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_START: return "wait_start";
2714  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SELECT_SLAVE: return "select_slave";
2715  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SEND_SLAVEOF_NOONE: return "send_slaveof_noone";
2716  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION: return "wait_promotion";
2717  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES: return "reconf_slaves";
2718  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG: return "update_config";
2719  default: return "unknown";
2720  }
2721 }
2722 
2723 /* Redis instance to Redis protocol representation. */
2724 void addReplySentinelRedisInstance(client *c, sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
2725  char *flags = sdsempty();
2726  void *mbl;
2727  int fields = 0;
2728 
2729  mbl = addDeferredMultiBulkLength(c);
2730 
2731  addReplyBulkCString(c,"name");
2732  addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->name);
2733  fields++;
2734 
2735  addReplyBulkCString(c,"ip");
2736  addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->addr->ip);
2737  fields++;
2738 
2739  addReplyBulkCString(c,"port");
2740  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->addr->port);
2741  fields++;
2742 
2743  addReplyBulkCString(c,"runid");
2744  addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->runid ? ri->runid : "");
2745  fields++;
2746 
2747  addReplyBulkCString(c,"flags");
2748  if (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) flags = sdscat(flags,"s_down,");
2749  if (ri->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) flags = sdscat(flags,"o_down,");
2750  if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) flags = sdscat(flags,"master,");
2751  if (ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) flags = sdscat(flags,"slave,");
2752  if (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) flags = sdscat(flags,"sentinel,");
2753  if (ri->link->disconnected) flags = sdscat(flags,"disconnected,");
2754  if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER_DOWN) flags = sdscat(flags,"master_down,");
2755  if (ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS)
2756  flags = sdscat(flags,"failover_in_progress,");
2757  if (ri->flags & SRI_PROMOTED) flags = sdscat(flags,"promoted,");
2758  if (ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_SENT) flags = sdscat(flags,"reconf_sent,");
2759  if (ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_INPROG) flags = sdscat(flags,"reconf_inprog,");
2760  if (ri->flags & SRI_RECONF_DONE) flags = sdscat(flags,"reconf_done,");
2761 
2762  if (sdslen(flags) != 0) sdsrange(flags,0,-2); /* remove last "," */
2763  addReplyBulkCString(c,flags);
2764  sdsfree(flags);
2765  fields++;
2766 
2767  addReplyBulkCString(c,"link-pending-commands");
2768  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->link->pending_commands);
2769  fields++;
2770 
2771  addReplyBulkCString(c,"link-refcount");
2772  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->link->refcount);
2773  fields++;
2774 
2775  if (ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) {
2776  addReplyBulkCString(c,"failover-state");
2777  addReplyBulkCString(c,(char*)sentinelFailoverStateStr(ri->failover_state));
2778  fields++;
2779  }
2780 
2781  addReplyBulkCString(c,"last-ping-sent");
2782  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,
2783  ri->link->act_ping_time ? (mstime() - ri->link->act_ping_time) : 0);
2784  fields++;
2785 
2786  addReplyBulkCString(c,"last-ok-ping-reply");
2787  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->link->last_avail_time);
2788  fields++;
2789 
2790  addReplyBulkCString(c,"last-ping-reply");
2791  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->link->last_pong_time);
2792  fields++;
2793 
2794  if (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) {
2795  addReplyBulkCString(c,"s-down-time");
2796  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime()-ri->s_down_since_time);
2797  fields++;
2798  }
2799 
2800  if (ri->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) {
2801  addReplyBulkCString(c,"o-down-time");
2802  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime()-ri->o_down_since_time);
2803  fields++;
2804  }
2805 
2806  addReplyBulkCString(c,"down-after-milliseconds");
2807  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->down_after_period);
2808  fields++;
2809 
2810  /* Masters and Slaves */
2811  if (ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE)) {
2812  addReplyBulkCString(c,"info-refresh");
2813  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->info_refresh);
2814  fields++;
2815 
2816  addReplyBulkCString(c,"role-reported");
2817  addReplyBulkCString(c, (ri->role_reported == SRI_MASTER) ? "master" :
2818  "slave");
2819  fields++;
2820 
2821  addReplyBulkCString(c,"role-reported-time");
2822  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->role_reported_time);
2823  fields++;
2824  }
2825 
2826  /* Only masters */
2827  if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) {
2828  addReplyBulkCString(c,"config-epoch");
2829  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->config_epoch);
2830  fields++;
2831 
2832  addReplyBulkCString(c,"num-slaves");
2833  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,dictSize(ri->slaves));
2834  fields++;
2835 
2836  addReplyBulkCString(c,"num-other-sentinels");
2837  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,dictSize(ri->sentinels));
2838  fields++;
2839 
2840  addReplyBulkCString(c,"quorum");
2841  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->quorum);
2842  fields++;
2843 
2844  addReplyBulkCString(c,"failover-timeout");
2845  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->failover_timeout);
2846  fields++;
2847 
2848  addReplyBulkCString(c,"parallel-syncs");
2849  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->parallel_syncs);
2850  fields++;
2851 
2852  if (ri->notification_script) {
2853  addReplyBulkCString(c,"notification-script");
2854  addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->notification_script);
2855  fields++;
2856  }
2857 
2858  if (ri->client_reconfig_script) {
2859  addReplyBulkCString(c,"client-reconfig-script");
2860  addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->client_reconfig_script);
2861  fields++;
2862  }
2863  }
2864 
2865  /* Only slaves */
2866  if (ri->flags & SRI_SLAVE) {
2867  addReplyBulkCString(c,"master-link-down-time");
2868  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->master_link_down_time);
2869  fields++;
2870 
2871  addReplyBulkCString(c,"master-link-status");
2872  addReplyBulkCString(c,
2873  (ri->slave_master_link_status == SENTINEL_MASTER_LINK_STATUS_UP) ?
2874  "ok" : "err");
2875  fields++;
2876 
2877  addReplyBulkCString(c,"master-host");
2878  addReplyBulkCString(c,
2879  ri->slave_master_host ? ri->slave_master_host : "?");
2880  fields++;
2881 
2882  addReplyBulkCString(c,"master-port");
2883  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->slave_master_port);
2884  fields++;
2885 
2886  addReplyBulkCString(c,"slave-priority");
2887  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->slave_priority);
2888  fields++;
2889 
2890  addReplyBulkCString(c,"slave-repl-offset");
2891  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->slave_repl_offset);
2892  fields++;
2893  }
2894 
2895  /* Only sentinels */
2896  if (ri->flags & SRI_SENTINEL) {
2897  addReplyBulkCString(c,"last-hello-message");
2898  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,mstime() - ri->last_hello_time);
2899  fields++;
2900 
2901  addReplyBulkCString(c,"voted-leader");
2902  addReplyBulkCString(c,ri->leader ? ri->leader : "?");
2903  fields++;
2904 
2905  addReplyBulkCString(c,"voted-leader-epoch");
2906  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,ri->leader_epoch);
2907  fields++;
2908  }
2909 
2910  setDeferredMultiBulkLength(c,mbl,fields*2);
2911 }
2912 
2913 /* Output a number of instances contained inside a dictionary as
2914  * Redis protocol. */
2915 void addReplyDictOfRedisInstances(client *c, dict *instances) {
2916  dictIterator *di;
2917  dictEntry *de;
2918 
2919  di = dictGetIterator(instances);
2920  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,dictSize(instances));
2921  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2922  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
2923 
2924  addReplySentinelRedisInstance(c,ri);
2925  }
2926  dictReleaseIterator(di);
2927 }
2928 
2929 /* Lookup the named master into sentinel.masters.
2930  * If the master is not found reply to the client with an error and returns
2931  * NULL. */
2932 sentinelRedisInstance *sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(client *c,
2933  robj *name)
2934 {
2935  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2936 
2937  ri = dictFetchValue(sentinel.masters,name->ptr);
2938  if (!ri) {
2939  addReplyError(c,"No such master with that name");
2940  return NULL;
2941  }
2942  return ri;
2943 }
2944 
2945 #define SENTINEL_ISQR_OK 0
2946 #define SENTINEL_ISQR_NOQUORUM (1<<0)
2947 #define SENTINEL_ISQR_NOAUTH (1<<1)
2948 int sentinelIsQuorumReachable(sentinelRedisInstance *master, int *usableptr) {
2949  dictIterator *di;
2950  dictEntry *de;
2951  int usable = 1; /* Number of usable Sentinels. Init to 1 to count myself. */
2952  int result = SENTINEL_ISQR_OK;
2953  int voters = dictSize(master->sentinels)+1; /* Known Sentinels + myself. */
2954 
2955  di = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
2956  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
2957  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
2958 
2959  if (ri->flags & (SRI_S_DOWN|SRI_O_DOWN)) continue;
2960  usable++;
2961  }
2962  dictReleaseIterator(di);
2963 
2964  if (usable < (int)master->quorum) result |= SENTINEL_ISQR_NOQUORUM;
2965  if (usable < voters/2+1) result |= SENTINEL_ISQR_NOAUTH;
2966  if (usableptr) *usableptr = usable;
2967  return result;
2968 }
2969 
2970 void sentinelCommand(client *c) {
2971  if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"masters")) {
2972  /* SENTINEL MASTERS */
2973  if (c->argc != 2) goto numargserr;
2974  addReplyDictOfRedisInstances(c,sentinel.masters);
2975  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"master")) {
2976  /* SENTINEL MASTER <name> */
2977  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2978 
2979  if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2980  if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2]))
2981  == NULL) return;
2982  addReplySentinelRedisInstance(c,ri);
2983  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"slaves") ||
2984  !strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"replicas"))
2985  {
2986  /* SENTINEL REPLICAS <master-name> */
2987  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2988 
2989  if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2990  if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2])) == NULL)
2991  return;
2992  addReplyDictOfRedisInstances(c,ri->slaves);
2993  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"sentinels")) {
2994  /* SENTINEL SENTINELS <master-name> */
2995  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
2996 
2997  if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
2998  if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2])) == NULL)
2999  return;
3000  addReplyDictOfRedisInstances(c,ri->sentinels);
3001  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"is-master-down-by-addr")) {
3002  /* SENTINEL IS-MASTER-DOWN-BY-ADDR <ip> <port> <current-epoch> <runid>
3003  *
3004  * Arguments:
3005  *
3006  * ip and port are the ip and port of the master we want to be
3007  * checked by Sentinel. Note that the command will not check by
3008  * name but just by master, in theory different Sentinels may monitor
3009  * differnet masters with the same name.
3010  *
3011  * current-epoch is needed in order to understand if we are allowed
3012  * to vote for a failover leader or not. Each Sentinel can vote just
3013  * one time per epoch.
3014  *
3015  * runid is "*" if we are not seeking for a vote from the Sentinel
3016  * in order to elect the failover leader. Otherwise it is set to the
3017  * runid we want the Sentinel to vote if it did not already voted.
3018  */
3019  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
3020  long long req_epoch;
3021  uint64_t leader_epoch = 0;
3022  char *leader = NULL;
3023  long port;
3024  int isdown = 0;
3025 
3026  if (c->argc != 6) goto numargserr;
3027  if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[3],&port,NULL) != C_OK ||
3028  getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[4],&req_epoch,NULL)
3029  != C_OK)
3030  return;
3031  ri = getSentinelRedisInstanceByAddrAndRunID(sentinel.masters,
3032  c->argv[2]->ptr,port,NULL);
3033 
3034  /* It exists? Is actually a master? Is subjectively down? It's down.
3035  * Note: if we are in tilt mode we always reply with "0". */
3036  if (!sentinel.tilt && ri && (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) &&
3037  (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER))
3038  isdown = 1;
3039 
3040  /* Vote for the master (or fetch the previous vote) if the request
3041  * includes a runid, otherwise the sender is not seeking for a vote. */
3042  if (ri && ri->flags & SRI_MASTER && strcasecmp(c->argv[5]->ptr,"*")) {
3043  leader = sentinelVoteLeader(ri,(uint64_t)req_epoch,
3044  c->argv[5]->ptr,
3045  &leader_epoch);
3046  }
3047 
3048  /* Reply with a three-elements multi-bulk reply:
3049  * down state, leader, vote epoch. */
3050  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,3);
3051  addReply(c, isdown ? shared.cone : shared.czero);
3052  addReplyBulkCString(c, leader ? leader : "*");
3053  addReplyLongLong(c, (long long)leader_epoch);
3054  if (leader) sdsfree(leader);
3055  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"reset")) {
3056  /* SENTINEL RESET <pattern> */
3057  if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
3058  addReplyLongLong(c,sentinelResetMastersByPattern(c->argv[2]->ptr,SENTINEL_GENERATE_EVENT));
3059  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"get-master-addr-by-name")) {
3060  /* SENTINEL GET-MASTER-ADDR-BY-NAME <master-name> */
3061  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
3062 
3063  if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
3064  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(c->argv[2]->ptr);
3065  if (ri == NULL) {
3066  addReply(c,shared.nullmultibulk);
3067  } else {
3068  sentinelAddr *addr = sentinelGetCurrentMasterAddress(ri);
3069 
3070  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,2);
3071  addReplyBulkCString(c,addr->ip);
3072  addReplyBulkLongLong(c,addr->port);
3073  }
3074  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"failover")) {
3075  /* SENTINEL FAILOVER <master-name> */
3076  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
3077 
3078  if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
3079  if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2])) == NULL)
3080  return;
3081  if (ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) {
3082  addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-INPROG Failover already in progress\r\n"));
3083  return;
3084  }
3085  if (sentinelSelectSlave(ri) == NULL) {
3086  addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-NOGOODSLAVE No suitable replica to promote\r\n"));
3087  return;
3088  }
3089  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Executing user requested FAILOVER of '%s'",
3090  ri->name);
3091  sentinelStartFailover(ri);
3092  ri->flags |= SRI_FORCE_FAILOVER;
3093  addReply(c,shared.ok);
3094  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"pending-scripts")) {
3095  /* SENTINEL PENDING-SCRIPTS */
3096 
3097  if (c->argc != 2) goto numargserr;
3098  sentinelPendingScriptsCommand(c);
3099  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"monitor")) {
3100  /* SENTINEL MONITOR <name> <ip> <port> <quorum> */
3101  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
3102  long quorum, port;
3103  char ip[NET_IP_STR_LEN];
3104 
3105  if (c->argc != 6) goto numargserr;
3106  if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[5],&quorum,"Invalid quorum")
3107  != C_OK) return;
3108  if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[4],&port,"Invalid port")
3109  != C_OK) return;
3110 
3111  if (quorum <= 0) {
3112  addReplyError(c, "Quorum must be 1 or greater.");
3113  return;
3114  }
3115 
3116  /* Make sure the IP field is actually a valid IP before passing it
3117  * to createSentinelRedisInstance(), otherwise we may trigger a
3118  * DNS lookup at runtime. */
3119  if (anetResolveIP(NULL,c->argv[3]->ptr,ip,sizeof(ip)) == ANET_ERR) {
3120  addReplyError(c,"Invalid IP address specified");
3121  return;
3122  }
3123 
3124  /* Parameters are valid. Try to create the master instance. */
3125  ri = createSentinelRedisInstance(c->argv[2]->ptr,SRI_MASTER,
3126  c->argv[3]->ptr,port,quorum,NULL);
3127  if (ri == NULL) {
3128  switch(errno) {
3129  case EBUSY:
3130  addReplyError(c,"Duplicated master name");
3131  break;
3132  case EINVAL:
3133  addReplyError(c,"Invalid port number");
3134  break;
3135  default:
3136  addReplyError(c,"Unspecified error adding the instance");
3137  break;
3138  }
3139  } else {
3140  sentinelFlushConfig();
3141  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+monitor",ri,"%@ quorum %d",ri->quorum);
3142  addReply(c,shared.ok);
3143  }
3144  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"flushconfig")) {
3145  if (c->argc != 2) goto numargserr;
3146  sentinelFlushConfig();
3147  addReply(c,shared.ok);
3148  return;
3149  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"remove")) {
3150  /* SENTINEL REMOVE <name> */
3151  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
3152 
3153  if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
3154  if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2]))
3155  == NULL) return;
3156  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-monitor",ri,"%@");
3157  dictDelete(sentinel.masters,c->argv[2]->ptr);
3158  sentinelFlushConfig();
3159  addReply(c,shared.ok);
3160  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"ckquorum")) {
3161  /* SENTINEL CKQUORUM <name> */
3162  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
3163  int usable;
3164 
3165  if (c->argc != 3) goto numargserr;
3166  if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2]))
3167  == NULL) return;
3168  int result = sentinelIsQuorumReachable(ri,&usable);
3169  if (result == SENTINEL_ISQR_OK) {
3170  addReplySds(c, sdscatfmt(sdsempty(),
3171  "+OK %i usable Sentinels. Quorum and failover authorization "
3172  "can be reached\r\n",usable));
3173  } else {
3174  sds e = sdscatfmt(sdsempty(),
3175  "-NOQUORUM %i usable Sentinels. ",usable);
3176  if (result & SENTINEL_ISQR_NOQUORUM)
3177  e = sdscat(e,"Not enough available Sentinels to reach the"
3178  " specified quorum for this master");
3179  if (result & SENTINEL_ISQR_NOAUTH) {
3180  if (result & SENTINEL_ISQR_NOQUORUM) e = sdscat(e,". ");
3181  e = sdscat(e, "Not enough available Sentinels to reach the"
3182  " majority and authorize a failover");
3183  }
3184  e = sdscat(e,"\r\n");
3185  addReplySds(c,e);
3186  }
3187  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"set")) {
3188  if (c->argc < 3) goto numargserr;
3189  sentinelSetCommand(c);
3190  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"info-cache")) {
3191  /* SENTINEL INFO-CACHE <name> */
3192  if (c->argc < 2) goto numargserr;
3193  mstime_t now = mstime();
3194 
3195  /* Create an ad-hoc dictionary type so that we can iterate
3196  * a dictionary composed of just the master groups the user
3197  * requested. */
3198  dictType copy_keeper = instancesDictType;
3199  copy_keeper.valDestructor = NULL;
3200  dict *masters_local = sentinel.masters;
3201  if (c->argc > 2) {
3202  masters_local = dictCreate(&copy_keeper, NULL);
3203 
3204  for (int i = 2; i < c->argc; i++) {
3205  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
3206  ri = sentinelGetMasterByName(c->argv[i]->ptr);
3207  if (!ri) continue; /* ignore non-existing names */
3208  dictAdd(masters_local, ri->name, ri);
3209  }
3210  }
3211 
3212  /* Reply format:
3213  * 1.) master name
3214  * 2.) 1.) info from master
3215  * 2.) info from replica
3216  * ...
3217  * 3.) other master name
3218  * ...
3219  */
3220  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,dictSize(masters_local) * 2);
3221 
3222  dictIterator *di;
3223  dictEntry *de;
3224  di = dictGetIterator(masters_local);
3225  while ((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3226  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
3227  addReplyBulkCBuffer(c,ri->name,strlen(ri->name));
3228  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,dictSize(ri->slaves) + 1); /* +1 for self */
3229  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,2);
3230  addReplyLongLong(c, now - ri->info_refresh);
3231  if (ri->info)
3232  addReplyBulkCBuffer(c,ri->info,sdslen(ri->info));
3233  else
3234  addReply(c,shared.nullbulk);
3235 
3236  dictIterator *sdi;
3237  dictEntry *sde;
3238  sdi = dictGetIterator(ri->slaves);
3239  while ((sde = dictNext(sdi)) != NULL) {
3240  sentinelRedisInstance *sri = dictGetVal(sde);
3241  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,2);
3242  addReplyLongLong(c, now - sri->info_refresh);
3243  if (sri->info)
3244  addReplyBulkCBuffer(c,sri->info,sdslen(sri->info));
3245  else
3246  addReply(c,shared.nullbulk);
3247  }
3248  dictReleaseIterator(sdi);
3249  }
3250  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3251  if (masters_local != sentinel.masters) dictRelease(masters_local);
3252  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"simulate-failure")) {
3253  /* SENTINEL SIMULATE-FAILURE <flag> <flag> ... <flag> */
3254  int j;
3255 
3256  sentinel.simfailure_flags = SENTINEL_SIMFAILURE_NONE;
3257  for (j = 2; j < c->argc; j++) {
3258  if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"crash-after-election")) {
3259  sentinel.simfailure_flags |=
3260  SENTINEL_SIMFAILURE_CRASH_AFTER_ELECTION;
3261  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Failure simulation: this Sentinel "
3262  "will crash after being successfully elected as failover "
3263  "leader");
3264  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"crash-after-promotion")) {
3265  sentinel.simfailure_flags |=
3266  SENTINEL_SIMFAILURE_CRASH_AFTER_PROMOTION;
3267  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Failure simulation: this Sentinel "
3268  "will crash after promoting the selected replica to master");
3269  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"help")) {
3270  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,2);
3271  addReplyBulkCString(c,"crash-after-election");
3272  addReplyBulkCString(c,"crash-after-promotion");
3273  } else {
3274  addReplyError(c,"Unknown failure simulation specified");
3275  return;
3276  }
3277  }
3278  addReply(c,shared.ok);
3279  } else {
3280  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown sentinel subcommand '%s'",
3281  (char*)c->argv[1]->ptr);
3282  }
3283  return;
3284 
3285 numargserr:

3287  (char*)c->argv[1]->ptr);

3296  sdsfree(redissection); \
3297  } \
3298 } while(0)

3300 /* SENTINEL INFO [section] */
3301 void sentinelInfoCommand(client *c) {

3305  }

3311  defsections = !strcasecmp(section,"default");

3314  }

3318

3320  info_section_from_redis("clients");
3321  info_section_from_redis("cpu");
3322  info_section_from_redis("stats");

3324  if (defsections || allsections || !strcasecmp(section,"sentinel")) {
3325  dictIterator *di;
3326  dictEntry *de;

3354  ri->addr->ip, ri->addr->port,
3355  dictSize(ri->slaves),
3356  dictSize(ri->sentinels)+1);
3357  }

3359  }
3360

3383 /* SENTINEL SET <mastername> [<option> <value> ...] */
3384 void sentinelSetCommand(client *c) {
3385  sentinelRedisInstance *ri;
3386  int j, changes = 0;
3387  int badarg = 0; /* Bad argument position for error reporting. */
3388  char *option;
3389 
3390  if ((ri = sentinelGetMasterByNameOrReplyError(c,c->argv[2]))
3391  == NULL) return;
3392 
3393  /* Process option - value pairs. */
3394  for (j = 3; j < c->argc; j++) {
3395  int moreargs = (c->argc-1) - j;
3396  option = c->argv[j]->ptr;
3397  long long ll;
3398  int old_j = j; /* Used to know what to log as an event. */
3399 
3400  if (!strcasecmp(option,"down-after-milliseconds") && moreargs > 0) {
3401  /* down-after-millisecodns <milliseconds> */
3402  robj *o = c->argv[++j];
3403  if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&ll) == C_ERR || ll <= 0) {
3404  badarg = j;
3405  goto badfmt;
3406  }
3407  ri->down_after_period = ll;
3408  sentinelPropagateDownAfterPeriod(ri);
3409  changes++;
3410  } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"failover-timeout") && moreargs > 0) {
3411  /* failover-timeout <milliseconds> */
3412  robj *o = c->argv[++j];
3413  if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&ll) == C_ERR || ll <= 0) {
3414  badarg = j;
3415  goto badfmt;
3416  }
3417  ri->failover_timeout = ll;
3418  changes++;
3419  } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"parallel-syncs") && moreargs > 0) {
3420  /* parallel-syncs <milliseconds> */
3421  robj *o = c->argv[++j];
3422  if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&ll) == C_ERR || ll <= 0) {
3423  badarg = j;
3424  goto badfmt;
3425  }
3426  ri->parallel_syncs = ll;
3427  changes++;
3428  } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"notification-script") && moreargs > 0) {
3429  /* notification-script <path> */
3430  char *value = c->argv[++j]->ptr;
3431  if (sentinel.deny_scripts_reconfig) {
3432  addReplyError(c,
3433  "Reconfiguration of scripts path is denied for "
3434  "security reasons. Check the deny-scripts-reconfig "
3435  "configuration directive in your Sentinel configuration");
3436  return;
3437  }
3438 
3439  if (strlen(value) && access(value,X_OK) == -1) {
3440  addReplyError(c,
3441  "Notification script seems non existing or non executable");
3442  if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
3443  return;
3444  }
3445  sdsfree(ri->notification_script);
3446  ri->notification_script = strlen(value) ? sdsnew(value) : NULL;
3447  changes++;
3448  } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"client-reconfig-script") && moreargs > 0) {
3449  /* client-reconfig-script <path> */
3450  char *value = c->argv[++j]->ptr;
3451  if (sentinel.deny_scripts_reconfig) {
3452  addReplyError(c,
3453  "Reconfiguration of scripts path is denied for "
3454  "security reasons. Check the deny-scripts-reconfig "
3455  "configuration directive in your Sentinel configuration");
3456  return;
3457  }
3458 
3459  if (strlen(value) && access(value,X_OK) == -1) {
3460  addReplyError(c,
3461  "Client reconfiguration script seems non existing or "
3462  "non executable");
3463  if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
3464  return;
3465  }
3466  sdsfree(ri->client_reconfig_script);
3467  ri->client_reconfig_script = strlen(value) ? sdsnew(value) : NULL;
3468  changes++;
3469  } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"auth-pass") && moreargs > 0) {
3470  /* auth-pass <password> */
3471  char *value = c->argv[++j]->ptr;
3472  sdsfree(ri->auth_pass);
3473  ri->auth_pass = strlen(value) ? sdsnew(value) : NULL;
3474  changes++;
3475  } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"quorum") && moreargs > 0) {
3476  /* quorum <count> */
3477  robj *o = c->argv[++j];
3478  if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&ll) == C_ERR || ll <= 0) {
3479  badarg = j;
3480  goto badfmt;
3481  }
3482  ri->quorum = ll;
3483  changes++;
3484  } else if (!strcasecmp(option,"rename-command") && moreargs > 1) {
3485  /* rename-command <oldname> <newname> */
3486  sds oldname = c->argv[++j]->ptr;
3487  sds newname = c->argv[++j]->ptr;
3488 
3489  if ((sdslen(oldname) == 0) || (sdslen(newname) == 0)) {
3490  badarg = sdslen(newname) ? j-1 : j;
3491  goto badfmt;
3492  }
3493 
3494  /* Remove any older renaming for this command. */
3495  dictDelete(ri->renamed_commands,oldname);
3496 
3497  /* If the target name is the same as the source name there
3498  * is no need to add an entry mapping to itself. */
3499  if (!dictSdsKeyCaseCompare(NULL,oldname,newname)) {
3500  oldname = sdsdup(oldname);
3501  newname = sdsdup(newname);
3502  dictAdd(ri->renamed_commands,oldname,newname);
3503  }
3504  changes++;
3505  } else {
3506  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown option or number of arguments for "
3507  "SENTINEL SET '%s'", option);
3508  if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
3509  return;
3510  }
3511 
3512  /* Log the event. */
3513  int numargs = j-old_j+1;
3514  switch(numargs) {
3515  case 2:
3516  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+set",ri,"%@ %s %s",c->argv[old_j]->ptr,
3517  c->argv[old_j+1]->ptr);
3518  break;
3519  case 3:
3520  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+set",ri,"%@ %s %s %s",c->argv[old_j]->ptr,
3521  c->argv[old_j+1]->ptr,
3522  c->argv[old_j+2]->ptr);
3523  break;
3524  default:
3525  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+set",ri,"%@ %s",c->argv[old_j]->ptr);
3526  break;
3527  }
3528  }
3529 
3530  if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
3531  addReply(c,shared.ok);
3532  return;
3533 
3534 badfmt: /* Bad format errors */
3535  if (changes) sentinelFlushConfig();
3536  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid argument '%s' for SENTINEL SET '%s'",
3537  (char*)c->argv[badarg]->ptr,option);
3538 }

3540 /* Our fake PUBLISH command: it is actually useful only to receive hello messages

3542  * SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL is forbidden.
3543  *
3544  * Because we have a Sentinel PUBLISH, the code to send hello messages is the same
3545  * for all the three kind of instances: masters, slaves, sentinels. */
3546 void sentinelPublishCommand(client *c) {
3547  if (strcmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,SENTINEL_HELLO_CHANNEL)) {
3548  addReplyError(c, "Only HELLO messages are accepted by Sentinel instances.");
3549  return;
3550  }

3552  addReplyLongLong(c,1);
