3555 /* ===================== SENTINEL availability checks ======================= */
3556 
3557 /* Is this instance down from our point of view? */
3558 void sentinelCheckSubjectivelyDown(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
3559  mstime_t elapsed = 0;
3560 
3561  if (ri->link->act_ping_time)
3562  elapsed = mstime() - ri->link->act_ping_time;
3563  else if (ri->link->disconnected)
3564  elapsed = mstime() - ri->link->last_avail_time;
3565 
3566  /* Check if we are in need for a reconnection of one of the
3567  * links, because we are detecting low activity.
3568  *
3569  * 1) Check if the command link seems connected, was connected not less
3570  * than SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD, but still we have a
3571  * pending ping for more than half the timeout. */
3572  if (ri->link->cc &&
3573  (mstime() - ri->link->cc_conn_time) >
3574  SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD &&
3575  ri->link->act_ping_time != 0 && /* There is a pending ping... */
3576  /* The pending ping is delayed, and we did not receive
3577  * error replies as well. */
3578  (mstime() - ri->link->act_ping_time) > (ri->down_after_period/2) &&
3579  (mstime() - ri->link->last_pong_time) > (ri->down_after_period/2))
3580  {
3581  instanceLinkCloseConnection(ri->link,ri->link->cc);
3582  }
3583 
3584  /* 2) Check if the pubsub link seems connected, was connected not less
3585  * than SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD, but still we have no
3586  * activity in the Pub/Sub channel for more than
3587  * SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD * 3.
3588  */
3589  if (ri->link->pc &&
3590  (mstime() - ri->link->pc_conn_time) >
3591  SENTINEL_MIN_LINK_RECONNECT_PERIOD &&
3592  (mstime() - ri->link->pc_last_activity) > (SENTINEL_PUBLISH_PERIOD*3))
3593  {
3594  instanceLinkCloseConnection(ri->link,ri->link->pc);
3595  }
3596 
3597  /* Update the SDOWN flag. We believe the instance is SDOWN if:
3598  *
3599  * 1) It is not replying.
3600  * 2) We believe it is a master, it reports to be a slave for enough time
3601  * to meet the down_after_period, plus enough time to get two times
3602  * INFO report from the instance. */
3603  if (elapsed > ri->down_after_period ||
3604  (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER &&
3605  ri->role_reported == SRI_SLAVE &&
3606  mstime() - ri->role_reported_time >
3607  (ri->down_after_period+SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD*2)))
3608  {
3609  /* Is subjectively down */
3610  if ((ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) == 0) {
3611  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+sdown",ri,"%@");
3612  ri->s_down_since_time = mstime();
3613  ri->flags |= SRI_S_DOWN;
3614  }
3615  } else {
3616  /* Is subjectively up */
3617  if (ri->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) {
3618  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-sdown",ri,"%@");
3619  ri->flags &= ~(SRI_S_DOWN|SRI_SCRIPT_KILL_SENT);
3620  }
3621  }
3622 }
3623 
3624 /* Is this instance down according to the configured quorum?
3625  *
3626  * Note that ODOWN is a weak quorum, it only means that enough Sentinels
3627  * reported in a given time range that the instance was not reachable.
3628  * However messages can be delayed so there are no strong guarantees about
3629  * N instances agreeing at the same time about the down state. */
3630 void sentinelCheckObjectivelyDown(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3631  dictIterator *di;
3632  dictEntry *de;
3633  unsigned int quorum = 0, odown = 0;
3634 
3635  if (master->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) {
3636  /* Is down for enough sentinels? */
3637  quorum = 1; /* the current sentinel. */
3638  /* Count all the other sentinels. */
3639  di = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
3640  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3641  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
3642 
3643  if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER_DOWN) quorum++;
3644  }
3645  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3646  if (quorum >= master->quorum) odown = 1;
3647  }
3648 
3649  /* Set the flag accordingly to the outcome. */
3650  if (odown) {
3651  if ((master->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) == 0) {
3652  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+odown",master,"%@ #quorum %d/%d",
3653  quorum, master->quorum);
3654  master->flags |= SRI_O_DOWN;
3655  master->o_down_since_time = mstime();
3656  }
3657  } else {
3658  if (master->flags & SRI_O_DOWN) {
3659  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-odown",master,"%@");
3660  master->flags &= ~SRI_O_DOWN;
3661  }
3662  }
3663 }
3664 
3665 /* Receive the SENTINEL is-master-down-by-addr reply, see the
3666  * sentinelAskMasterStateToOtherSentinels() function for more information. */
3667 void sentinelReceiveIsMasterDownReply(redisAsyncContext *c, void *reply, void *privdata) {
3668  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = privdata;
3669  instanceLink *link = c->data;
3670  redisReply *r;
3671 
3672  if (!reply || !link) return;
3673  link->pending_commands--;
3674  r = reply;
3675 
3676  /* Ignore every error or unexpected reply.
3677  * Note that if the command returns an error for any reason we'll
3678  * end clearing the SRI_MASTER_DOWN flag for timeout anyway. */
3679  if (r->type == REDIS_REPLY_ARRAY && r->elements == 3 &&
3680  r->element[0]->type == REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER &&
3681  r->element[1]->type == REDIS_REPLY_STRING &&
3682  r->element[2]->type == REDIS_REPLY_INTEGER)
3683  {
3684  ri->last_master_down_reply_time = mstime();
3685  if (r->element[0]->integer == 1) {
3686  ri->flags |= SRI_MASTER_DOWN;
3687  } else {
3688  ri->flags &= ~SRI_MASTER_DOWN;
3689  }
3690  if (strcmp(r->element[1]->str,"*")) {
3691  /* If the runid in the reply is not "*" the Sentinel actually
3692  * replied with a vote. */
3693  sdsfree(ri->leader);
3694  if ((long long)ri->leader_epoch != r->element[2]->integer)
3695  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
3696  "%s voted for %s %llu", ri->name,
3697  r->element[1]->str,
3698  (unsigned long long) r->element[2]->integer);
3699  ri->leader = sdsnew(r->element[1]->str);
3700  ri->leader_epoch = r->element[2]->integer;
3701  }
3702  }
3703 }
3704 
3705 /* If we think the master is down, we start sending
3706  * SENTINEL IS-MASTER-DOWN-BY-ADDR requests to other sentinels
3707  * in order to get the replies that allow to reach the quorum
3708  * needed to mark the master in ODOWN state and trigger a failover. */
3709 #define SENTINEL_ASK_FORCED (1<<0)
3710 void sentinelAskMasterStateToOtherSentinels(sentinelRedisInstance *master, int flags) {
3711  dictIterator *di;
3712  dictEntry *de;
3713 
3714  di = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
3715  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3716  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
3717  mstime_t elapsed = mstime() - ri->last_master_down_reply_time;
3718  char port[32];
3719  int retval;
3720 
3721  /* If the master state from other sentinel is too old, we clear it. */
3722  if (elapsed > SENTINEL_ASK_PERIOD*5) {
3723  ri->flags &= ~SRI_MASTER_DOWN;
3724  sdsfree(ri->leader);
3725  ri->leader = NULL;
3726  }
3727 
3728  /* Only ask if master is down to other sentinels if:
3729  *
3730  * 1) We believe it is down, or there is a failover in progress.
3731  * 2) Sentinel is connected.
3732  * 3) We did not receive the info within SENTINEL_ASK_PERIOD ms. */
3733  if ((master->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) == 0) continue;
3734  if (ri->link->disconnected) continue;
3735  if (!(flags & SENTINEL_ASK_FORCED) &&
3736  mstime() - ri->last_master_down_reply_time < SENTINEL_ASK_PERIOD)
3737  continue;
3738 
3739  /* Ask */
3740  ll2string(port,sizeof(port),master->addr->port);
3741  retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
3742  sentinelReceiveIsMasterDownReply, ri,
3743  "%s is-master-down-by-addr %s %s %llu %s",
3744  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"SENTINEL"),
3745  master->addr->ip, port,
3746  sentinel.current_epoch,
3747  (master->failover_state > SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE) ?
3748  sentinel.myid : "*");
3749  if (retval == C_OK) ri->link->pending_commands++;
3750  }
3751  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3752 }
3753 
3754 /* =============================== FAILOVER ================================= */
3755 
3756 /* Crash because of user request via SENTINEL simulate-failure command. */
3757 void sentinelSimFailureCrash(void) {
3758  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
3759  "Sentinel CRASH because of SENTINEL simulate-failure");
3760  exit(99);
3761 }
3762 
3763 /* Vote for the sentinel with 'req_runid' or return the old vote if already
3764  * voted for the specified 'req_epoch' or one greater.
3765  *
3766  * If a vote is not available returns NULL, otherwise return the Sentinel
3767  * runid and populate the leader_epoch with the epoch of the vote. */
3768 char *sentinelVoteLeader(sentinelRedisInstance *master, uint64_t req_epoch, char *req_runid, uint64_t *leader_epoch) {
3769  if (req_epoch > sentinel.current_epoch) {
3770  sentinel.current_epoch = req_epoch;
3771  sentinelFlushConfig();
3772  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+new-epoch",master,"%llu",
3773  (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch);
3774  }
3775 
3776  if (master->leader_epoch < req_epoch && sentinel.current_epoch <= req_epoch)
3777  {
3778  sdsfree(master->leader);
3779  master->leader = sdsnew(req_runid);
3780  master->leader_epoch = sentinel.current_epoch;
3781  sentinelFlushConfig();
3782  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+vote-for-leader",master,"%s %llu",
3783  master->leader, (unsigned long long) master->leader_epoch);
3784  /* If we did not voted for ourselves, set the master failover start
3785  * time to now, in order to force a delay before we can start a
3786  * failover for the same master. */
3787  if (strcasecmp(master->leader,sentinel.myid))
3788  master->failover_start_time = mstime()+rand()%SENTINEL_MAX_DESYNC;
3789  }
3790 
3791  *leader_epoch = master->leader_epoch;
3792  return master->leader ? sdsnew(master->leader) : NULL;
3793 }
3794 
3795 struct sentinelLeader {
3796  char *runid;
3797  unsigned long votes;
3798 };
3799 
3800 /* Helper function for sentinelGetLeader, increment the counter
3801  * relative to the specified runid. */
3802 int sentinelLeaderIncr(dict *counters, char *runid) {
3803  dictEntry *existing, *de;
3804  uint64_t oldval;
3805 
3806  de = dictAddRaw(counters,runid,&existing);
3807  if (existing) {
3808  oldval = dictGetUnsignedIntegerVal(existing);
3809  dictSetUnsignedIntegerVal(existing,oldval+1);
3810  return oldval+1;
3811  } else {
3812  serverAssert(de != NULL);
3813  dictSetUnsignedIntegerVal(de,1);
3814  return 1;
3815  }
3816 }
3817 
3818 /* Scan all the Sentinels attached to this master to check if there
3819  * is a leader for the specified epoch.
3820  *
3821  * To be a leader for a given epoch, we should have the majority of
3822  * the Sentinels we know (ever seen since the last SENTINEL RESET) that
3823  * reported the same instance as leader for the same epoch. */
3824 char *sentinelGetLeader(sentinelRedisInstance *master, uint64_t epoch) {
3825  dict *counters;
3826  dictIterator *di;
3827  dictEntry *de;
3828  unsigned int voters = 0, voters_quorum;
3829  char *myvote;
3830  char *winner = NULL;
3831  uint64_t leader_epoch;
3832  uint64_t max_votes = 0;
3833 
3834  serverAssert(master->flags & (SRI_O_DOWN|SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS));
3835  counters = dictCreate(&leaderVotesDictType,NULL);
3836 
3837  voters = dictSize(master->sentinels)+1; /* All the other sentinels and me.*/
3838 
3839  /* Count other sentinels votes */
3840  di = dictGetIterator(master->sentinels);
3841  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3842  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
3843  if (ri->leader != NULL && ri->leader_epoch == sentinel.current_epoch)
3844  sentinelLeaderIncr(counters,ri->leader);
3845  }
3846  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3847 
3848  /* Check what's the winner. For the winner to win, it needs two conditions:
3849  * 1) Absolute majority between voters (50% + 1).
3850  * 2) And anyway at least master->quorum votes. */
3851  di = dictGetIterator(counters);
3852  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3853  uint64_t votes = dictGetUnsignedIntegerVal(de);
3854 
3855  if (votes > max_votes) {
3856  max_votes = votes;
3857  winner = dictGetKey(de);
3858  }
3859  }
3860  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3861 
3862  /* Count this Sentinel vote:
3863  * if this Sentinel did not voted yet, either vote for the most
3864  * common voted sentinel, or for itself if no vote exists at all. */
3865  if (winner)
3866  myvote = sentinelVoteLeader(master,epoch,winner,&leader_epoch);
3867  else
3868  myvote = sentinelVoteLeader(master,epoch,sentinel.myid,&leader_epoch);
3869 
3870  if (myvote && leader_epoch == epoch) {
3871  uint64_t votes = sentinelLeaderIncr(counters,myvote);
3872 
3873  if (votes > max_votes) {
3874  max_votes = votes;
3875  winner = myvote;
3876  }
3877  }
3878 
3879  voters_quorum = voters/2+1;
3880  if (winner && (max_votes < voters_quorum || max_votes < master->quorum))
3881  winner = NULL;
3882 
3883  winner = winner ? sdsnew(winner) : NULL;
3884  sdsfree(myvote);
3885  dictRelease(counters);
3886  return winner;
3887 }
3888 
3889 /* Send SLAVEOF to the specified instance, always followed by a
3890  * CONFIG REWRITE command in order to store the new configuration on disk
3891  * when possible (that is, if the Redis instance is recent enough to support
3892  * config rewriting, and if the server was started with a configuration file).
3893  *
3894  * If Host is NULL the function sends "SLAVEOF NO ONE".
3895  *
3896  * The command returns C_OK if the SLAVEOF command was accepted for
3897  * (later) delivery otherwise C_ERR. The command replies are just
3898  * discarded. */
3899 int sentinelSendSlaveOf(sentinelRedisInstance *ri, char *host, int port) {
3900  char portstr[32];
3901  int retval;
3902 
3903  ll2string(portstr,sizeof(portstr),port);
3904 
3905  /* If host is NULL we send SLAVEOF NO ONE that will turn the instance
3906  * into a master. */
3907  if (host == NULL) {
3908  host = "NO";
3909  memcpy(portstr,"ONE",4);
3910  }
3911 
3912  /* In order to send SLAVEOF in a safe way, we send a transaction performing
3913  * the following tasks:
3914  * 1) Reconfigure the instance according to the specified host/port params.
3915  * 2) Rewrite the configuration.
3916  * 3) Disconnect all clients (but this one sending the commnad) in order
3917  * to trigger the ask-master-on-reconnection protocol for connected
3918  * clients.
3919  *
3920  * Note that we don't check the replies returned by commands, since we
3921  * will observe instead the effects in the next INFO output. */
3922  retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
3923  sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, ri, "%s",
3924  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"MULTI"));
3925  if (retval == C_ERR) return retval;
3926  ri->link->pending_commands++;
3927 
3928  retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
3929  sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, ri, "%s %s %s",
3930  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"SLAVEOF"),
3931  host, portstr);
3932  if (retval == C_ERR) return retval;
3933  ri->link->pending_commands++;
3934 
3935  retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
3936  sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, ri, "%s REWRITE",
3937  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"CONFIG"));
3938  if (retval == C_ERR) return retval;
3939  ri->link->pending_commands++;
3940 
3941  /* CLIENT KILL TYPE <type> is only supported starting from Redis 2.8.12,
3942  * however sending it to an instance not understanding this command is not
3943  * an issue because CLIENT is variadic command, so Redis will not
3944  * recognized as a syntax error, and the transaction will not fail (but
3945  * only the unsupported command will fail). */
3946  retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
3947  sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, ri, "%s KILL TYPE normal",
3948  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"CLIENT"));
3949  if (retval == C_ERR) return retval;
3950  ri->link->pending_commands++;
3951 
3952  retval = redisAsyncCommand(ri->link->cc,
3953  sentinelDiscardReplyCallback, ri, "%s",
3954  sentinelInstanceMapCommand(ri,"EXEC"));
3955  if (retval == C_ERR) return retval;
3956  ri->link->pending_commands++;
3957 
3958  return C_OK;
3959 }
3960 
3961 /* Setup the master state to start a failover. */
3962 void sentinelStartFailover(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3963  serverAssert(master->flags & SRI_MASTER);
3964 
3965  master->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_START;
3966  master->flags |= SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS;
3967  master->failover_epoch = ++sentinel.current_epoch;
3968  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+new-epoch",master,"%llu",
3969  (unsigned long long) sentinel.current_epoch);
3970  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+try-failover",master,"%@");
3971  master->failover_start_time = mstime()+rand()%SENTINEL_MAX_DESYNC;
3972  master->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
3973 }
3974 
3975 /* This function checks if there are the conditions to start the failover,
3976  * that is:
3977  *
3978  * 1) Master must be in ODOWN condition.
3979  * 2) No failover already in progress.
3980  * 3) No failover already attempted recently.
3981  *
3982  * We still don't know if we'll win the election so it is possible that we
3983  * start the failover but that we'll not be able to act.
3984  *
3985  * Return non-zero if a failover was started. */
3986 int sentinelStartFailoverIfNeeded(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
3987  /* We can't failover if the master is not in O_DOWN state. */
3988  if (!(master->flags & SRI_O_DOWN)) return 0;
3989 
3990  /* Failover already in progress? */
3991  if (master->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS) return 0;
3992 
3993  /* Last failover attempt started too little time ago? */
3994  if (mstime() - master->failover_start_time <
3995  master->failover_timeout*2)
3996  {
3997  if (master->failover_delay_logged != master->failover_start_time) {
3998  time_t clock = (master->failover_start_time +
3999  master->failover_timeout*2) / 1000;
4000  char ctimebuf[26];
4001 
4002  ctime_r(&clock,ctimebuf);
4003  ctimebuf[24] = '\0'; /* Remove newline. */
4004  master->failover_delay_logged = master->failover_start_time;
4005  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
4006  "Next failover delay: I will not start a failover before %s",
4007  ctimebuf);
4008  }
4009  return 0;
4010  }
4011 
4012  sentinelStartFailover(master);
4013  return 1;
4014 }
4015 
4016 /* Select a suitable slave to promote. The current algorithm only uses
4017  * the following parameters:
4018  *
4019  * 1) None of the following conditions: S_DOWN, O_DOWN, DISCONNECTED.
4020  * 2) Last time the slave replied to ping no more than 5 times the PING period.
4021  * 3) info_refresh not older than 3 times the INFO refresh period.
4022  * 4) master_link_down_time no more than:
4023  * (now - master->s_down_since_time) + (master->down_after_period * 10).
4024  * Basically since the master is down from our POV, the slave reports
4025  * to be disconnected no more than 10 times the configured down-after-period.
4026  * This is pretty much black magic but the idea is, the master was not
4027  * available so the slave may be lagging, but not over a certain time.
4028  * Anyway we'll select the best slave according to replication offset.
4029  * 5) Slave priority can't be zero, otherwise the slave is discarded.
4030  *
4031  * Among all the slaves matching the above conditions we select the slave
4032  * with, in order of sorting key:
4033  *
4034  * - lower slave_priority.
4035  * - bigger processed replication offset.
4036  * - lexicographically smaller runid.
4037  *
4038  * Basically if runid is the same, the slave that processed more commands
4039  * from the master is selected.
4040  *
4041  * The function returns the pointer to the selected slave, otherwise
4042  * NULL if no suitable slave was found.
4043  */
4044 
4045 /* Helper for sentinelSelectSlave(). This is used by qsort() in order to
4046  * sort suitable slaves in a "better first" order, to take the first of
4047  * the list. */
4048 int compareSlavesForPromotion(const void *a, const void *b) {
4049  sentinelRedisInstance **sa = (sentinelRedisInstance **)a,
4050  **sb = (sentinelRedisInstance **)b;
4051  char *sa_runid, *sb_runid;
4052 
4053  if ((*sa)->slave_priority != (*sb)->slave_priority)
4054  return (*sa)->slave_priority - (*sb)->slave_priority;
4055 
4056  /* If priority is the same, select the slave with greater replication
4057  * offset (processed more data from the master). */
4058  if ((*sa)->slave_repl_offset > (*sb)->slave_repl_offset) {
4059  return -1; /* a < b */
4060  } else if ((*sa)->slave_repl_offset < (*sb)->slave_repl_offset) {
4061  return 1; /* a > b */
4062  }
4063 
4064  /* If the replication offset is the same select the slave with that has
4065  * the lexicographically smaller runid. Note that we try to handle runid
4066  * == NULL as there are old Redis versions that don't publish runid in
4067  * INFO. A NULL runid is considered bigger than any other runid. */
4068  sa_runid = (*sa)->runid;
4069  sb_runid = (*sb)->runid;
4070  if (sa_runid == NULL && sb_runid == NULL) return 0;
4071  else if (sa_runid == NULL) return 1; /* a > b */
4072  else if (sb_runid == NULL) return -1; /* a < b */
4073  return strcasecmp(sa_runid, sb_runid);
4074 }
4075 
4076 sentinelRedisInstance *sentinelSelectSlave(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
4077  sentinelRedisInstance **instance =
4078  zmalloc(sizeof(instance[0])*dictSize(master->slaves));
4079  sentinelRedisInstance *selected = NULL;
4080  int instances = 0;
4081  dictIterator *di;
4082  dictEntry *de;
4083  mstime_t max_master_down_time = 0;
4084 
4085  if (master->flags & SRI_S_DOWN)
4086  max_master_down_time += mstime() - master->s_down_since_time;
4087  max_master_down_time += master->down_after_period * 10;
4088 
4089  di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
4090  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4091  sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
4092  mstime_t info_validity_time;
4093 
4094  if (slave->flags & (SRI_S_DOWN|SRI_O_DOWN)) continue;
4095  if (slave->link->disconnected) continue;
4096  if (mstime() - slave->link->last_avail_time > SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD*5) continue;
4097  if (slave->slave_priority == 0) continue;
4098 
4099  /* If the master is in SDOWN state we get INFO for slaves every second.
4100  * Otherwise we get it with the usual period so we need to account for
4101  * a larger delay. */
4102  if (master->flags & SRI_S_DOWN)
4103  info_validity_time = SENTINEL_PING_PERIOD*5;
4104  else
4105  info_validity_time = SENTINEL_INFO_PERIOD*3;
4106  if (mstime() - slave->info_refresh > info_validity_time) continue;
4107  if (slave->master_link_down_time > max_master_down_time) continue;
4108  instance[instances++] = slave;
4109  }
4110  dictReleaseIterator(di);
4111  if (instances) {
4112  qsort(instance,instances,sizeof(sentinelRedisInstance*),
4113  compareSlavesForPromotion);
4114  selected = instance[0];
4115  }
4116  zfree(instance);
4117  return selected;
4118 }
4119 
4120 /* ---------------- Failover state machine implementation ------------------- */
4121 void sentinelFailoverWaitStart(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
4122  char *leader;
4123  int isleader;
4124 
4125  /* Check if we are the leader for the failover epoch. */
4126  leader = sentinelGetLeader(ri, ri->failover_epoch);
4127  isleader = leader && strcasecmp(leader,sentinel.myid) == 0;
4128  sdsfree(leader);
4129 
4130  /* If I'm not the leader, and it is not a forced failover via
4131  * SENTINEL FAILOVER, then I can't continue with the failover. */
4132  if (!isleader && !(ri->flags & SRI_FORCE_FAILOVER)) {
4133  int election_timeout = SENTINEL_ELECTION_TIMEOUT;
4134 
4135  /* The election timeout is the MIN between SENTINEL_ELECTION_TIMEOUT
4136  * and the configured failover timeout. */
4137  if (election_timeout > ri->failover_timeout)
4138  election_timeout = ri->failover_timeout;
4139  /* Abort the failover if I'm not the leader after some time. */
4140  if (mstime() - ri->failover_start_time > election_timeout) {
4141  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-failover-abort-not-elected",ri,"%@");
4142  sentinelAbortFailover(ri);
4143  }
4144  return;
4145  }
4146  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+elected-leader",ri,"%@");
4147  if (sentinel.simfailure_flags & SENTINEL_SIMFAILURE_CRASH_AFTER_ELECTION)
4148  sentinelSimFailureCrash();
4149  ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SELECT_SLAVE;
4150  ri->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
4151  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+failover-state-select-slave",ri,"%@");
4152 }
4153 
4154 void sentinelFailoverSelectSlave(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
4155  sentinelRedisInstance *slave = sentinelSelectSlave(ri);
4156 
4157  /* We don't handle the timeout in this state as the function aborts
4158  * the failover or go forward in the next state. */
4159  if (slave == NULL) {
4160  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-failover-abort-no-good-slave",ri,"%@");
4161  sentinelAbortFailover(ri);
4162  } else {
4163  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+selected-slave",slave,"%@");
4164  slave->flags |= SRI_PROMOTED;
4165  ri->promoted_slave = slave;
4166  ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SEND_SLAVEOF_NOONE;
4167  ri->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
4168  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+failover-state-send-slaveof-noone",
4169  slave, "%@");
4170  }
4171 }
4172 
4173 void sentinelFailoverSendSlaveOfNoOne(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
4174  int retval;
4175 
4176  /* We can't send the command to the promoted slave if it is now
4177  * disconnected. Retry again and again with this state until the timeout
4178  * is reached, then abort the failover. */
4179  if (ri->promoted_slave->link->disconnected) {
4180  if (mstime() - ri->failover_state_change_time > ri->failover_timeout) {
4181  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-failover-abort-slave-timeout",ri,"%@");
4182  sentinelAbortFailover(ri);
4183  }
4184  return;
4185  }
4186 
4187  /* Send SLAVEOF NO ONE command to turn the slave into a master.
4188  * We actually register a generic callback for this command as we don't
4189  * really care about the reply. We check if it worked indirectly observing
4190  * if INFO returns a different role (master instead of slave). */
4191  retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(ri->promoted_slave,NULL,0);
4192  if (retval != C_OK) return;
4193  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE, "+failover-state-wait-promotion",
4194  ri->promoted_slave,"%@");
4195  ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION;
4196  ri->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
4197 }
4198 
4199 /* We actually wait for promotion indirectly checking with INFO when the
4200  * slave turns into a master. */
4201 void sentinelFailoverWaitPromotion(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
4202  /* Just handle the timeout. Switching to the next state is handled
4203  * by the function parsing the INFO command of the promoted slave. */
4204  if (mstime() - ri->failover_state_change_time > ri->failover_timeout) {
4205  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-failover-abort-slave-timeout",ri,"%@");
4206  sentinelAbortFailover(ri);
4207  }
4208 }
4209 
4210 void sentinelFailoverDetectEnd(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
4211  int not_reconfigured = 0, timeout = 0;
4212  dictIterator *di;
4213  dictEntry *de;
4214  mstime_t elapsed = mstime() - master->failover_state_change_time;
4215 
4216  /* We can't consider failover finished if the promoted slave is
4217  * not reachable. */
4218  if (master->promoted_slave == NULL ||
4219  master->promoted_slave->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) return;
4220 
4221  /* The failover terminates once all the reachable slaves are properly
4222  * configured. */
4223  di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
4224  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4225  sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
4226 
4227  if (slave->flags & (SRI_PROMOTED|SRI_RECONF_DONE)) continue;
4228  if (slave->flags & SRI_S_DOWN) continue;
4229  not_reconfigured++;
4230  }
4231  dictReleaseIterator(di);
4232 
4233  /* Force end of failover on timeout. */
4234  if (elapsed > master->failover_timeout) {
4235  not_reconfigured = 0;
4236  timeout = 1;
4237  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+failover-end-for-timeout",master,"%@");
4238  }
4239 
4240  if (not_reconfigured == 0) {
4241  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+failover-end",master,"%@");
4242  master->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG;
4243  master->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
4244  }
4245 
4246  /* If I'm the leader it is a good idea to send a best effort SLAVEOF
4247  * command to all the slaves still not reconfigured to replicate with
4248  * the new master. */
4249  if (timeout) {
4250  dictIterator *di;
4251  dictEntry *de;
4252 
4253  di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
4254  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4255  sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
4256  int retval;
4257 
4258  if (slave->flags & (SRI_RECONF_DONE|SRI_RECONF_SENT)) continue;
4259  if (slave->link->disconnected) continue;
4260 
4261  retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(slave,
4262  master->promoted_slave->addr->ip,
4263  master->promoted_slave->addr->port);
4264  if (retval == C_OK) {
4265  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+slave-reconf-sent-be",slave,"%@");
4266  slave->flags |= SRI_RECONF_SENT;
4267  }
4268  }
4269  dictReleaseIterator(di);
4270  }
4271 }
4272 
4273 /* Send SLAVE OF <new master address> to all the remaining slaves that
4274  * still don't appear to have the configuration updated. */
4275 void sentinelFailoverReconfNextSlave(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
4276  dictIterator *di;
4277  dictEntry *de;
4278  int in_progress = 0;
4279 
4280  di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
4281  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4282  sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
4283 
4284  if (slave->flags & (SRI_RECONF_SENT|SRI_RECONF_INPROG))
4285  in_progress++;
4286  }
4287  dictReleaseIterator(di);
4288 
4289  di = dictGetIterator(master->slaves);
4290  while(in_progress < master->parallel_syncs &&
4291  (de = dictNext(di)) != NULL)
4292  {
4293  sentinelRedisInstance *slave = dictGetVal(de);
4294  int retval;
4295 
4296  /* Skip the promoted slave, and already configured slaves. */
4297  if (slave->flags & (SRI_PROMOTED|SRI_RECONF_DONE)) continue;
4298 
4299  /* If too much time elapsed without the slave moving forward to
4300  * the next state, consider it reconfigured even if it is not.
4301  * Sentinels will detect the slave as misconfigured and fix its
4302  * configuration later. */
4303  if ((slave->flags & SRI_RECONF_SENT) &&
4304  (mstime() - slave->slave_reconf_sent_time) >
4305  SENTINEL_SLAVE_RECONF_TIMEOUT)
4306  {
4307  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"-slave-reconf-sent-timeout",slave,"%@");
4308  slave->flags &= ~SRI_RECONF_SENT;
4309  slave->flags |= SRI_RECONF_DONE;
4310  }
4311 
4312  /* Nothing to do for instances that are disconnected or already
4313  * in RECONF_SENT state. */
4314  if (slave->flags & (SRI_RECONF_SENT|SRI_RECONF_INPROG)) continue;
4315  if (slave->link->disconnected) continue;
4316 
4317  /* Send SLAVEOF <new master>. */
4318  retval = sentinelSendSlaveOf(slave,
4319  master->promoted_slave->addr->ip,
4320  master->promoted_slave->addr->port);
4321  if (retval == C_OK) {
4322  slave->flags |= SRI_RECONF_SENT;
4323  slave->slave_reconf_sent_time = mstime();
4324  sentinelEvent(LL_NOTICE,"+slave-reconf-sent",slave,"%@");
4325  in_progress++;
4326  }
4327  }
4328  dictReleaseIterator(di);
4329 
4330  /* Check if all the slaves are reconfigured and handle timeout. */
4331  sentinelFailoverDetectEnd(master);
4332 }
4333 
4334 /* This function is called when the slave is in
4335  * SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG state. In this state we need
4336  * to remove it from the master table and add the promoted slave instead. */
4337 void sentinelFailoverSwitchToPromotedSlave(sentinelRedisInstance *master) {
4338  sentinelRedisInstance *ref = master->promoted_slave ?
4339  master->promoted_slave : master;
4340 
4341  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+switch-master",master,"%s %s %d %s %d",
4342  master->name, master->addr->ip, master->addr->port,
4343  ref->addr->ip, ref->addr->port);
4344 
4345  sentinelResetMasterAndChangeAddress(master,ref->addr->ip,ref->addr->port);
4346 }
4347 
4348 void sentinelFailoverStateMachine(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
4349  serverAssert(ri->flags & SRI_MASTER);
4350 
4351  if (!(ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS)) return;
4352 
4353  switch(ri->failover_state) {
4354  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_START:
4355  sentinelFailoverWaitStart(ri);
4356  break;
4357  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SELECT_SLAVE:
4358  sentinelFailoverSelectSlave(ri);
4359  break;
4360  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_SEND_SLAVEOF_NOONE:
4361  sentinelFailoverSendSlaveOfNoOne(ri);
4362  break;
4363  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION:
4364  sentinelFailoverWaitPromotion(ri);
4365  break;
4366  case SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_RECONF_SLAVES:
4367  sentinelFailoverReconfNextSlave(ri);
4368  break;
4369  }
4370 }
4371 
4372 /* Abort a failover in progress:
4373  *
4374  * This function can only be called before the promoted slave acknowledged
4375  * the slave -> master switch. Otherwise the failover can't be aborted and
4376  * will reach its end (possibly by timeout). */
4377 void sentinelAbortFailover(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
4378  serverAssert(ri->flags & SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS);
4379  serverAssert(ri->failover_state <= SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_WAIT_PROMOTION);
4380 
4381  ri->flags &= ~(SRI_FAILOVER_IN_PROGRESS|SRI_FORCE_FAILOVER);
4382  ri->failover_state = SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_NONE;
4383  ri->failover_state_change_time = mstime();
4384  if (ri->promoted_slave) {
4385  ri->promoted_slave->flags &= ~SRI_PROMOTED;
4386  ri->promoted_slave = NULL;
4387  }
4388 }
4389 
4390 /* ======================== SENTINEL timer handler ==========================
4391  * This is the "main" our Sentinel, being sentinel completely non blocking
4392  * in design. The function is called every second.
4393  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4394 
4395 /* Perform scheduled operations for the specified Redis instance. */
4396 void sentinelHandleRedisInstance(sentinelRedisInstance *ri) {
4397  /* ========== MONITORING HALF ============ */
4398  /* Every kind of instance */
4399  sentinelReconnectInstance(ri);
4400  sentinelSendPeriodicCommands(ri);
4401 
4402  /* ============== ACTING HALF ============= */
4403  /* We don't proceed with the acting half if we are in TILT mode.
4404  * TILT happens when we find something odd with the time, like a
4405  * sudden change in the clock. */
4406  if (sentinel.tilt) {
4407  if (mstime()-sentinel.tilt_start_time < SENTINEL_TILT_PERIOD) return;
4408  sentinel.tilt = 0;
4409  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"-tilt",NULL,"#tilt mode exited");
4410  }
4411 
4412  /* Every kind of instance */
4413  sentinelCheckSubjectivelyDown(ri);
4414 
4415  /* Masters and slaves */
4416  if (ri->flags & (SRI_MASTER|SRI_SLAVE)) {
4417  /* Nothing so far. */
4418  }
4419 
4420  /* Only masters */
4421  if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) {
4422  sentinelCheckObjectivelyDown(ri);
4423  if (sentinelStartFailoverIfNeeded(ri))
4424  sentinelAskMasterStateToOtherSentinels(ri,SENTINEL_ASK_FORCED);
4425  sentinelFailoverStateMachine(ri);
4426  sentinelAskMasterStateToOtherSentinels(ri,SENTINEL_NO_FLAGS);
4427  }
4428 }
4429 
4430 /* Perform scheduled operations for all the instances in the dictionary.
4431  * Recursively call the function against dictionaries of slaves. */
4432 void sentinelHandleDictOfRedisInstances(dict *instances) {
4433  dictIterator *di;
4434  dictEntry *de;
4435  sentinelRedisInstance *switch_to_promoted = NULL;
4436 
4437  /* There are a number of things we need to perform against every master. */
4438  di = dictGetIterator(instances);
4439  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4440  sentinelRedisInstance *ri = dictGetVal(de);
4441 
4442  sentinelHandleRedisInstance(ri);
4443  if (ri->flags & SRI_MASTER) {
4444  sentinelHandleDictOfRedisInstances(ri->slaves);
4445  sentinelHandleDictOfRedisInstances(ri->sentinels);
4446  if (ri->failover_state == SENTINEL_FAILOVER_STATE_UPDATE_CONFIG) {
4447  switch_to_promoted = ri;
4448  }
4449  }
4450  }
4451  if (switch_to_promoted)
4452  sentinelFailoverSwitchToPromotedSlave(switch_to_promoted);
4453  dictReleaseIterator(di);
4454 }
4455 
4456 /* This function checks if we need to enter the TITL mode.
4457  *
4458  * The TILT mode is entered if we detect that between two invocations of the
4459  * timer interrupt, a negative amount of time, or too much time has passed.
4460  * Note that we expect that more or less just 100 milliseconds will pass
4461  * if everything is fine. However we'll see a negative number or a
4462  * difference bigger than SENTINEL_TILT_TRIGGER milliseconds if one of the
4463  * following conditions happen:
4464  *
4465  * 1) The Sentiel process for some time is blocked, for every kind of
4466  * random reason: the load is huge, the computer was frozen for some time
4467  * in I/O or alike, the process was stopped by a signal. Everything.
4468  * 2) The system clock was altered significantly.
4469  *
4470  * Under both this conditions we'll see everything as timed out and failing
4471  * without good reasons. Instead we enter the TILT mode and wait
4472  * for SENTINEL_TILT_PERIOD to elapse before starting to act again.
4473  *
4474  * During TILT time we still collect information, we just do not act. */
4475 void sentinelCheckTiltCondition(void) {
4476  mstime_t now = mstime();
4477  mstime_t delta = now - sentinel.previous_time;
4478 
4479  if (delta < 0 || delta > SENTINEL_TILT_TRIGGER) {
4480  sentinel.tilt = 1;
4481  sentinel.tilt_start_time = mstime();
4482  sentinelEvent(LL_WARNING,"+tilt",NULL,"#tilt mode entered");
4483  }
4484  sentinel.previous_time = mstime();
4485 }
4486 
4487 void sentinelTimer(void) {
4488  sentinelCheckTiltCondition();
4489  sentinelHandleDictOfRedisInstances(sentinel.masters);
4490  sentinelRunPendingScripts();
4491  sentinelCollectTerminatedScripts();
4492  sentinelKillTimedoutScripts();
4493 
4494  /* We continuously change the frequency of the Redis "timer interrupt"
4495  * in order to desynchronize every Sentinel from every other.
4496  * This non-determinism avoids that Sentinels started at the same time
4497  * exactly continue to stay synchronized asking to be voted at the
4498  * same time again and again (resulting in nobody likely winning the
4499  * election because of split brain voting). */
4500  server.hz = CONFIG_DEFAULT_HZ + rand() % CONFIG_DEFAULT_HZ;
4501 }
